Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: sripali
Reviews.Content: I have paid over £250/= for 2 night. I stayed with my wife over there. Room was quite small and bathroom was not clean either. This is the worst hotel I said for last five year. I do fly frequently as well. I have accidentally left my belonging in the room when I checked out. But When I spoke to reception they were not helpful. Specially a guy call " Patrick" was not a nice person at all and he was not helpful at all. He didn't bother to listen to me what I have left in the room and he said nothing found. I think when we spend more than £100/ per night would expect better service. Further I have spent time in Paris before but most hotels were good.

Reviews.Title: “Very small!”
Reviews.Author: LindaMurcia
Reviews.Content: If you need a single room and you are flexible and supple as a result of your Pilates or Yoga classes, then this is the hotel for you! You will enjoy the challenge of showering without bumping your knees or elbows and slithering past the toilet to towel yourself dry in front of the sink, avoiding hitting your head on the hairdryer. If you are very tall, your knees might even touch the wall when you are on the loo!!! I couldn't open both doors of the wardrobe without moving the bed, and I thought there was hanging space only. After the room had been cleaned, my own hairdryer wasn't on the bed where I had left it and I was convinced it had been stolen!!! Fortunately, I discovered that on the left hand side of the wardrobe there were, in fact, some shelves and that it had been tidied it away! These challenges apart, I would unreservedly recommend this hotel. It is in an excellent position, within walking distance of the Gard du Nord - (uphill on the way back as you drag your suitcase) - and perfect for walking to the Opera area and beyond. The street is quiet so you shouldn't be disturbed at night. The decor is quiet and tasteful, and the bed linen soft. The standard of cleanliness is excellent. The breakfast was perfect - delicious coffee, fruit juice with "bits" (not that horrible diluted squash-like drink served in some hotels), fruit salad, yoghurts, cereal, a range of pastries and bread, good quality jams and honey, as well as cheese and ham. The scrambled eggs were some of the best I have ever tasted, and there were crepes, too. The dining room is in the basement (perhaps a converted wine cellar?) It is small and you might have to make friends with the people on the table next to you in high season, but I went in March and the guests were mostly business people who didn't spend long eating. There is even a small garden. I would stay there again (and take some plasters in case I grazed myself in the bathroom!)

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for short break”
Reviews.Author: Nojhaslam
Reviews.Content: My wife and here stayed here for 2 nights, and for our needs it was ideal. - LOCATION: It is roughly equidistant between Notre Dame and the Eiffel Tower (around 2 miles to each), so perfectly walkable if you have a decent pair of shoes. However, there is a Metro stop a 2 minute walk away, which takes you to Concorde if you prefer. The local area also seems to be more typically Parisian - i.e. small, independent shops rather than chains. - HOTEL: the exterior and reception are beautiful, and seem much better than you have any right to expect from a 3* hotel. - STAFF: this won't matter to everyone, but our French isn't great so to have a staff that speak great English is a great help. For example, I wanted some moules et frites while I was there, and I was directed to somewhere that was great. They also offered a shuttle service to the airport upon check-in, which when you're on limited time is a great help. - ROOMS: the rooms aren't cavernous, but should suit your needs perfectly. Very well kept too. All in all, considering how expensive Paris can be, this hotel offers good value in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Gem”
Reviews.Author: MAGG_8
Reviews.Content: Ideal location for walking Paris streets and sights. Quiet location and convenient for Metro. Great and helpful staff, all very clean - worth visiting....

Reviews.Title: “Convienient”
Reviews.Author: ITA_And_RE_a
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well situated, with a metro stop a couple of blocks away. There are restaurants,cafes and shops in the area, and is obviously a neighbor where locals live. The rooms are small, but very clean, the bathrooms are spotless. Housekeeping is efficent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ronlieb51
Reviews.Content: This is the fourth time that I've stayed at the hotel and the experince has been great. Didi and Henri have been particularly helpful to my wife and I. Excellent location. Near the Pigatelle and St. George Metro Stations. One can walk to the Saint Lazard train station. The hotel is located in the heart of art history. Accross the street is the Pere Tanguay Gallery where Van Gogh displayed his paintings. Rooms are good and very clean. The Rue de Martyrs offers several cheese and pastry shops. Many delicious cafes nearby, especially Cafe Limo, Fuxia, and Festivo to name a few. A residential area and one to offer the real Paris experience. It's a 30 minute walk to the Louvre.

Reviews.Title: “Compact and bijou!”
Reviews.Author: G Jerrom J
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel in a good location. The room was a wee bit small but when we commented to the (English-speaking) receptionist at check out we were advised to ask for a larger room next trip as they do have lots of them. The breakfast was more than adequate, the cleanliness of the hotel and room itself was excellenet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Sweet Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Thunderb0lt
Reviews.Content: If you want easy access to the metro, this is a great hotel. If you prefer to stay above ground and walk/eat your way through Paris, it's even better. It's only a block from Blvd des Matyrs, which boasts some of the best cheese, charcuterie, boulangerie, patisserie, produce and wine shops to be found, plus some great cafes...who needs a restaurant when you can buy bits and pieces and picnic for days. There's also a "used clothes" shop just down the block where you can find vintage french and international designer clothes and shoes for next to nothing. The hotel itself is excellent, very clean, good internet, great staff. They will direct you to the "above ground" options. Try the hop on/hop off bus to understand Paris. Or take an easy walk to Montmartre, Pigalle or Gare du Nord.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Stay In Town”
Reviews.Author: Hamish M
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 nights in late Sept. 2011 and recommend this hotel. Close to Metro Station, restaurants and easy walk to down town Paris. Accomodation above average and very clean. Excellent breakfast. Staff very helpful (especially Henri). Organised day trips and taxi`s when required

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Very Clean”
Reviews.Author: Peg S
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four nights, and the Trois Poussins was a great home base from which to explore Paris. Amazing location - close to Montmartre and a short walk to the Opera, Galleries Lafayette, etc. I had a single room, and it was TINY but fine for one person. The shower was a pretty tight fit. Bed was comfortable, and the room was cleaned every day. The lobby was nice to hang out in while waiting for friends, and even comes with a house kitty cat who is often curled up in the chairs of the lobby. Very cute, and added to the charm of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and good quality”
Reviews.Author: Diana V
Reviews.Content: I was in Paris last weekend for 4 night in this hotel. It is near to two underground station, and the Moulin Rouge is 5 minutes walking. So you can go walking to every place because it is the best for seeing the City. The Bedroom was not big but not small, it was clean and very new. They offer you a really good breakfast with really good quality and the best croissants that i have never eaten. So, I recomend you this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Loopyloolooloo
Reviews.Content: Spent a couple of nights here recently, would highly recommend this small hotel in Paris. Great location, we arrived late and ate well at a restaurant in the square at the end of the road. Quiet, safe area, though minutes away from Montmartre by foot, and the rest of Paris just a short walk in the opposite direction. St Georges metro just around the corner. Comfy beds and good shower, and a delicious french breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Fourth visit and gets better each time”
Reviews.Author: MrBLondon
Reviews.Content: We arrived Wednesday 16th Nov at 6pm and were made very welcome in the very reception, check in was easy and the receptionist spoke good English. We were offered the totally refurbished room just off reception, it was absolutely beautiful but as light sleepers were concerned about being close to the reception with the noise. We were given another executive room which had be mostly refurbished but as we had stayed in the exact room twice before we knew the bathroom was still the same, which needs a bit more care & attention. This room was very very clean and the linen was fresh and clean. The room is very well done, the bed was one of the most comfortable we had ever slept in Hotel wise. There is a mini kitchenette within the room, fridge, sink small 2 ring hob, but no kettle, no plug. There is only one plug socket we could find between the table and the chest of draws. This we find strange in a refurbished room, almost all travelers now have mobile phones, Laptops or Tablets so need power. It is also too far away from the large mirror for the 'GHD's'. We love this little Hotel, 15/20 mins walk from Gare du Nord station and perfectly situated for getting around. Many Cafe, restaurants and bars within a few minutes walk and the Metro is 5 mins walk away. We have stayed in many Hotels in Paris but this is by far the best for us and will continue to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Small but excellent rooms”
Reviews.Author: Charlotte B
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in November. The room was modern and clean, the bathroom and bedroom were small but were nicely set out and decorated. Had an elevator, and the breakfast was very decent. The location was good, in a nice neighborhood and easy walking distance to St. Georges metro station. Service was friendly and they understood and spoke english. Would recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Cathrine S
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in October. We arrived after a long flight from Singapore and were made to feel most welcome. The gentleman on the desk found us a room straightaway. It was clean and comfortable. It had a good shower. Breakfast was included in our package. It was plentiful and served by cheerful staff each morning. The hotel is well situated for sightseeing in Momatre, is near the Metro. Getting into Paris for sightseeing was easy. The room was quiet. We would certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Minor Complaints”
Reviews.Author: alicelikesdinosaurs
Reviews.Content: Great base for exploring Paris on an extended basis. A brief, easy walk to Sacre Coeur, easily in walkable distance of the Moulin Rouge, Hard Rock Cafe, Perfume Museum, and many other paris sights. The hotel itself is rather clean. I'm very picky and I don't see what people are complaining about. It is done in a traditional French style. There was some staining on the grout in the bathroom, but nothing major. It was not dirty in the slightest. The room was small, almost minuscule, but that is to be expected from European Hotels, and it is all functional. They have English-language television, and a safe in the room. You have to drop the key at Reception when you leave, a common theme between European Hotels, but something I dislike doing. It has a small elevator. The location is 7/10 - There are some great boulangerie (Bakeries), butcheries, chocolatiers, and cheese shops nearby and a good little cafe called "The No Stress Cafe" (the Vietmanese Salad is great). If you wander too far one way, you'll find yourself in a sleazy area, near the Moulin Rouge. This is about 5-6 blocks away from the hotel in one direction. If you wonder 5-6 blocks in the other direction, you find yourself at Galleries Lafayette, a shopping mall and one of the most expensive areas of Palace. This hotel makes Paris highly walkable for the right bank, but to get to the left bank, you will need a taxi or the metro (or auto bus). From the hotel to the Eiffel tower a taxi cost us 14 euro. It was a good base for us.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Georgia Z
Reviews.Content: I was there at Christmas time on 2009. The stuff was very helpful and polite. Also it was close to a metro station and it was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel,great location- recommend it!!”
Reviews.Author: frannym59
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here 1st week October 2011 for 7 nights. We were on the 4th floor(there is a lift) in a comfortable good sized twin room that ended up being bigger than the next hotel we stayed in. Beds were comfortable, good bathroom, good storage, clean room and nice helpful staff. (The Hotel Cat Clothette/Tinkerbell was a very cute bonus). The breakfast room in the cellar was lovely, and we found the breakfast to be more than ample. Good choice of cereals, toast, croissants, pastries, ham, cheese etc, tea, coffee, OJ, very enjoyable and fresh. We were a 2 minute walk from the local Metro St Georges, and local shops were around the corner, with a range of cafes and bistros nearby. We walked easily to the Opera district for shopping etc. We would happily stay at this hotel again. AND We would like to recommend Le Select Bistro around the corner in Rue des Martyrs, great food at a great price, we went there 3 times during our stay

Reviews.Title: “Cute, comfy, very helpful staff, safe”
Reviews.Author: genjisan
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying at this hotel. We had a fridge, safe, mini stove (interesting). I think my favorite part was the nice staff. Me and my friend did not speak any French so we wanted to do some touristy things like see a show at Moulin Rouge and goto Versailles. They totally helped us but understand that they take a small commission. The hotel was near the Montmartre which if you're familiar with NYC is equivalent to East Village/Lower East Side. It's a bit grimey and artsy. It's very convenient to the Metro (Saint Georges station) which easily connects to other subway lines to take you around Paris. We had breakfast included in our stay and it was lovely. It includes cereal, toast, croissants, fruit (albeit from a can), OJ, coffee, tea, yogurt, cheeses, deli meat. They have the cutest cat. Her name is Tinkerbell. She's adorable! I am not even a cat lover but she had character. You'll probably see her lounging on the chair in the lobby and she'll try to steal your breakfast so watch out for her!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Rousesonholiday
Reviews.Content: This is a very well run, friendly and reasonably priced hotel. Its location is excellent being close to many attractions while being essentially in a residential area. Staff are friendly and helpful, the rooms are well appointed and the breakfast is excellent. Will most definitely stay here when we return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel value”
Reviews.Author: rita999
Reviews.Content: This was a cute hotel with good size rooms. The room was clean and the metro was in walking distance. The only thing that I would say is that there was a sign on the door that said do not disturb and the front desk still called regularly to ask if the room needed to be cleaned. There were not as many local shops, but the close by metro provided easy access to local Paris sites. This hotel did have breakfast and internet service available for an additional fee. I would recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good price.”
Reviews.Author: philfrompenzance
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a trip to Paris where I stayed here. Front desk staff were very good in my opinion, the elevator was a little clunky but worked ok. The reception area was clean and well layed out. My room was a double on the 3rd floor and was clean and around the size I expect for a Paris hotel of this calibre, ie compact but perfectly acceptable. The bathroom was shower only(no bath) but that's fine as I prefer showers anyway. The housekeeping staff were very thorough and I couldn't fault the cleanliness at all. Breakfast was spread over a sensible time period and was continental style with plenty of options, including cold meats and cheeses if you wanted. All in all I couldn't fault the hotel for the price I paid, it's not super luxurious but it's certainly more than acceptable (and perfectly cleaned)if you have reasonable expectations and do your homework on Paris hotel prices!! Would I stay here again? Sure - I love the St Georges area for its accesibility and this place is smack on the money for what I needed. Must also say thanks to the other visitors/desk staff- I dropped my credit card whilst out smoking in the courtyard without noticing and had a call to my room within 20 minutes advising me that it was at the front desk. Thanks guys!!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, poor front desk service”
Reviews.Author: Chignon
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at 3 Poussins before- in 2008. Unfortunately, there has been a decline in the front desk staff. The rooms, as before, were great (I stayed in two- a 6th floor suite and a 5th floor double). The rooms are immaculate, beds very comfortable, bathrooms quite large for a Paris 3 star hotel. The housekeeping staff is obviously doing their job well. I can't say the same for the front desk. Seems out of control to say the least. I suspect some turbulent turnover going on- the same inept desk clerk has been there morning, noon and night for the past 2 days. Oddly, the competent ones are nowhere to be seen. Did they quit? En vacance? I am guessing the former. The front desk staff in general seem distracted by internal problems. The one I've been dealing with has made countless mistakes- room assignment, billing, airport shuttle, etc. and does not apologise at all for his unprofessional behaviour. The front desk needs to clean up it's act fast. At this time, I would trust the lobby cat to run the desk instead. 2 minor complaints: suite has kitchenette but no utensils- pointless n'est pas? Also, the wifi is a huge pain- you have to renew every 24 hours and if you step away even for 10 seconds, the connection is lost and you have to type in the cumbersome number again. Shoddy wifi service- it would be nice if 3 Poussins provided sensible wifi- which this is not. But again, no complaints at all about rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: graemeandcarolyn
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a weekend stay at Les Trois Poussins. We booked it through Airmiles and were delighted with the hotel. It is within a 15 minute walk from the Gare du Nord, the station you arrive at if you take the train from the airport, and since we only took hand luggage, we walked there from the station. The people on duty at reception were always polite and helpful, and we were able to get straight into our room, despite arriving at midday. (We had expected not to be able to check in til later. Yes, our room was on the small side, but perfect for a short stay. My only tiny grumble was that there was no toilet roll holder! Our room overlooked the back of the hotel and was very quiet indeed. Rooms at the front may have had some noise, but it is a quiet street. The local area was lovely..we could walk easily to Monmartre, and in fact the first day we had a good lunch at the local cafe (called the "No Stress Cafe") which is literally 100metres or so down the road. Being very close to the metro station was also a major plus point. I would happily return to this hotel...better start saving some more Airmiles!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: COMum
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in mid August and it couldn't have been better. We had two rooms on the top floor - one with a view of Sacre Coeur at night and the other with a balcony and views of the whole city from Notre Dame to the Eiffel Tower. Given that Paris is unbelievably busy in August and very expensive, our trip was much improved by staying in such a great place. The rooms were clean and spacious enough. They didn't seem to mind the kids racing the elevator up and down and even made us tea a couple of times. Breakfast was ok, but fresh fruit and semi-skimmed milk would have been nice. The concierges were all very helpful with directions and suggestions for places to eat. Henri in particular was very attentive. The kids loved playing with Clochette the cat. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Louise J
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel 3 years ago and on both occassions the standards have been very high. The hotel is located 2 mins from the metro and at the end of the road there are several good bars / restaurants. I asked the hotel to reccommend restaurants for both nights and their choices were excellent - they were extremely helpful and booked both of them for us. I booked in advance and would find the location and quality hard to beat for the rate.

Reviews.Title: “convenient location, nice neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: sequoia-design
Reviews.Content: Small room, furnishings nothing special. Very small shower stall (I'm 5 ft 7, average size - could not wash lower legs without hitting the water mixer (and turning the water off!). Old style wall-mounted hose type hair dryer. Breakfast was available (at 13 euros!) -- much cheaper to go out to one of the nearby cafes for breakfast. No pen or paper in the room. No in-room safe. Like many hotels in Europe, there is no kleenex in the room. Nice location - lots of good bakeries, cafes, shops, etc in the immediate vicinity; nice restaurant at 23 rue Clauzel. Metro within easy walking distance. Room was apparently considered handicapped accessible according to info on room door, but there is no that a wheel chair would have successfully negotiated in and out of the room and definitely could not have gotten into the shower. Helpful, multilingual staff.

Reviews.Title: “No charm in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brown1957
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a star rating of 3 and a half which we feel is over rated. All the receptionists were rude and, unhelpful. There was no car parking as advertised, there was no tea, coffee making facilities in the room, our room was the size of a dog kennel and the bed took up most of the room. We feel we did not get value for money. There fire safety notice stated " shut the door, stay in your room, wet a towel and place over your face and wait for assistance." No smoke detectors, or sprinkler systems in the room. No fire escapes from our room, felt unsafe.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and a nice hotel - very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: RonDorado
Reviews.Content: We first stayed here two years ago and enjoyed the hotel and the area tremendously so decided to go back for the last three nights of our vacations. Since our last stay the rooms have been updated and the beds are now very comfortable (too hard previously). We were initially given a very small room but we had been travelling for three weeks and just had too much luggage so we upgraded to a larger room (Thanks Henri!). If I had been travelling with a week-end bag the small room would have been just fine, but there was not enough room for two suitcases + hand luggage. The staff are friendly and everything is very clean but our main reason for choosing this hotel is the location. It is on a quiet street just next to Rue des Martyrs. On this road there are multiple patisseries, boucheries, charcuteries, fromage, wine merchants, and many cafés and restaurants. It is absolutely full of life, local Parisians, not just tourists. The hotel is between Opera and Montmartre so great for walking in any direction but Metro stations are very close by. I would highly recommend this as an affordable hotel in Paris. We always eat breakfast in local cafés and if you like eggs, rather than the usual “Viennoiserie” the omelette at the Café Select on Rue des Martyrs easily feeds two.

Reviews.Title: “Basic. Staff not very helpful.”
Reviews.Author: lapis-philosophorum
Reviews.Content: Hotel is not too bad, but not great either. Location is great. Lobby is cute, and the cat is adorable. Room was basic. Bed and pillows were very good. Bathroom could have been cleaner. On several occasions the staff was not particularly helpful. Average.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: officeadmin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located. The area of St Georges/Montmartre has a nice local feel and there are plenty of cafes, restaurants and interesting small shops at hand as well as the Metro station. The hotel is compact, but well run and presented. We had an Executive room which was worth the upgrade as it was larger and had a fridge in the small kitchen so we could keep a bottle of Champagne chilled. We got an inclusive breakfast deal - otherwise the breakfast (which is good) is quite expensive. There are alternative places for breakfast in Rue des Martyrs, three minutes walk away. Staff at the hotel are very friendly and helpful. Only negative would be the poor quality towels in the otherwise good bathroom. 10 minutes or so walk from Gare du Nord and otherwise very well located for all things Parisien.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in Paris”
Reviews.Author: chloebyrnes
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in Paris on a budget before and this is the best low cost, good value hotel I've stayed in. Great location in lovely area, nice clean room with view, clean bathroom, pleasant breakfast outside in little courtyard. Staff polite

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: rjgexplode
Reviews.Content: Great quality, great prices and a fantastic location from which to explore Paris. The only downside is that breakfast is a little sparse, but besides that I couldn't reccomend this hotel more.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Avril12_11
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Paris, the most comfortable beds of the whole trip. Not in the main area which makes it a quiet hotel to stay in. A smaller hotel with the personal touch

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect base for a few day's sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: thesmithsEssex
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel based on the good reviews on TA & the locationand we weren't disappointed. We were in room 203 which was a non refundable double executive room overlooking the street and worth the little extra I think as it was a decent size. We paid £128 per night which I don't think was the greatest value for money but then Paris isn't cheap. Good points - The location - a 20 minute, most of it flat, walk from Gare du nord and 5 mins (if that) from the metro station. It felt very much like a residential area, you could watch people coming home from work and going into their apartments in the building opposite and there were plenty of lovely little boulangeries, fruit shops, patisseries etc on the Rue des Martyrs. Yes, the red light area is a few streets away in the other direction, but it didn't encroach at all and I would have felt perfectly happy to walk around alone at night. Very clean & stylish room. Crisp white bedding, good a/c, powerful shower. Double glazing virtually entirely blocked out any noise - during the day it could be quite loud from scooters & kiddies from the school a few buildings down. Great night's sleep - it was very quiet at night - we didn't hear a peep from any other rooms. The bed was possibly the memory foam type - it was low and very comfortable with a duvet & thick soft pillows. Bad points - Minor niggles really....slightly mean bath towels and the hairdryer was one of those attached to the wall in the bathroom which I'm not a great fan of. Charge for the wifi of 4 euro per 24 hours (tip - when you log in you need to press done, then go rather than go & go) Little kitchenette area with fridge - we used the fridge but it would have been more useful if there had been perhaps a couple of plates, some cutlery etc provided which there wasn't. Also no tea making facilities. We didn't have breakfast so can't comment on the food but we had a nice meal one evening at La Maison Mere on rue des Navarins which is just round the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Great, quiet hotel in lovely spot”
Reviews.Author: Doh100
Reviews.Content: In summary, this hotel was spot on for our city break in terms of accomodation: rooms were very clean, had very good nights' sleep due to peace and quiet, only a few minutes walk to the metro, cafes and bakeries. The location was fantastic too - would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great short stay in small, clean, quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: pikey_fish
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in March, in a double room on the fourth floor. The hotel was very clean and quiet. There are free maps available to take at the front desk. The room was clean, it had a wardrobe and a safe. It wasn't on the large size, but it didn't matter to us. It had a good tv, a comfortable bed, and importantly a strong hot shower - better than mine at home! It had a small very basic kitchenette, with a fridge. We were able to stock up on a few breakfast snacks from the local Carrefour (4 mins walk). The breakfast isn't included, it is 13 Euros per person per day. We felt it was a bit steep especially as neither of us eat very much for breakfast, we would just have a coffee and snack out for much cheaper. There are two metro stations quite close by, but its also a good location from which to walk into central Paris. My companion and I walked to the louvre and then along the champs elysee, and then to the eiffel tower all in one day (Good Shoes Recommended!). Close by are a few nice boutiques, and some restaurants - an indian, and a duck restaurant are ones I remember. Also close by is a magazine/souvenir stand. If you're in a groups with children or if you're taking your parents/ in-laws here for example, you may like to know in advance that there are a few sex shops in the area, mainly on the walk from Pigalle metro to the hotel. If you go more north to Montmartre and the Sacre Coeur it is even more prevalent. However, we felt safe in the local area in the evenings. Some of the staff are not as friendly as they could be - we found that in general the Male staff were much more friendly than the Female staff. After 10pm you have to ring the doorbell to be buzzed in, but there is no curfew as such, you can be buzzed in any time of the night. The hotel has its own cat who is very friendly and very well cared for - it even followed us into the lift and into our room and didn't want to leave us! I'd visit again, the prices at 120 Euros a night were not too bad for Paris.

Reviews.Title: “what a difference a year makes”
Reviews.Author: peripateticdoctor
Reviews.Content: Our third time in Paris and also in this hotel.Previous experience was outstanding (friendly,helpful staff,clean,charming rooms and a great breakfast).Sadly,only the breakfast remains the same.New staff rude and dismissive.For instance, no explanation given when our room was not ready on until four hours after time of check in.When asked help to print our flight boarding passes, told to use an internet cafe "about six or seven blocks from the hotel",without even giving us directions to the place.Finally,the hotel, particularly the hallways smelled (most likely due to the cat that now sleeps in the reception room sofa).

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: JaxLatino
Reviews.Content: Small charming hotel, in an area full of little stores, places to eat. Close to two Metro stops. Professional, friendly staff, specially Jennifer who took time to give tips on places to visit, as well as times to go. Her English was excellent. The breakfast was nice and fulfilling, and the coffee was great! The room was small, but clean and the bed was comfortable. There was a safe in the room that was able to handle two iPads,two Nikon cameras, and a video camera. There is a cat in the hotel, who is very friendly. The bathroom is a little tight in space, but clean. It would get cold like an icebox in there if you would not leave the door open from the bedroom. Very close to Sacré-Cœur Basilica...and if you dare,,,the Moulin Rouge. We would stay in the hotel again. :-) You can buy unlimited access for internet (wifi) for three days for 45 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pete1664
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights. Reasonably priced hotel. Room modern and clean, although quite small. Continental Breakfast was included and this was buffet style with good quality cheese and ham, also tinned fruit, croissants, pastries, yogurt. Helpful staff. Would stay again. NB although several restaurants nearby most were fully booked on the saturday night. St George Metro 5 mins away. Moulin Rouge a 10min walk.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location ,good neighborhood,excellent hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: reelfine22
Reviews.Content: One minute walk top metro which takes you anywhere in Paris .

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable little hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: weaverbird6
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for a long weekend in Paris based on its Trip Advisor reviews and was not disappointed. The hotel was very comfortable and convenient at a good price, and the staff was pleasant and very helpful. The room is small but very clean and modern; the bed is quite comfortable and the bathroom is a decent size. Breakfast is a good value. Wireless internet is available in your room for a small fee. The neighborhood is a real treat with a variety of small shops, and nearby Rue des Martyrs is bustling on Sunday morning. The hotel is within easy walking distance of Montmartre and the metro. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, for the most part”
Reviews.Author: mo87
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location surrounded by little bars/restaurants/cafe's. The hotel itself is clean, comfortable and modern. We would have had a great time had it not been for a very loud party taking place in the courtyard of the apartment block beside the hotel, which went on until about 4am, making it impossible to sleep. The individual on reception kept us waiting when we came to check in as he was chatting on the phone to his friend. I was actually shocked that he kept me standing there waiting for him. I thought that this was rude and unprofessional, however the rest of the staff were pleasant and helpful over the course of the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Good little hotel - shame about the neighbours”
Reviews.Author: Koaldickie
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in this hotel for a weekend break in Paris. As per the other reviews it is in a great location being 15 mins walk to Gare du Nord, walking distance to Montmartre and also several metro stations. I have stayed in several hotel in Paris but even I was slightly surprised at how small the standard double room was - however - whilst it was small, it was perfectly formed with a very comfortable bed, good bedding, thick curtains, a very clean well equipped bathroom (strong water pressure) and good clean towels. Unfortunately, while we were there some neighbours decided to have a party until 3am in the morning with loud music which meant we couldn't sleep. The main issue was that it took me and my partner going round to the party three times to get the music turned off - the hotel staff were not at all proactive in resolving the situation. I understand that these things happen but we would have appreciated it if the staff had dealt with this rather than leaving it to the guests.

Reviews.Title: “Godd Value some minor issues”
Reviews.Author: traveladdict04
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband and it was a good value for money hotel, nice little breakfast and good cafes nearby as well as the metro. Front staff a bit off they are nice to you and then as you walk away they laugh, do they think we dont notice? Anyways room was pretty clean bathroom a outdated but the rest ok. All in all a good stay would try another hotel next time though,

Reviews.Title: “Tasteful, clean, recently renovated”
Reviews.Author: mst1
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks charming and clean from the outside as well as from the inside. Tastefully decorated, and most seems brand new. Staff was helpful and kind, my reservation was well received, there was no paperwork to do at the desk. Room and bed were a bit small, but that did not prevent me from sleeping well. There was a small kitchen attached to the room. The hotel was quiet at night. The street is quiet as well, and the neighborhood is safe and clean, with bakeries, butcheries..., these nice shops that make a neighborhoud typically French. If you stroll in the morning towards rue des Martyrs, you'll smell the fresh bread and croissants. A supermarket Monop' next to Notre-Dame-de-Lorette. In a few minutes you're at the Boulevards. There is a parking in the same street, almost in front of the hotel. I feel I got a good deal and I'm very happy with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Totally fine”
Reviews.Author: HereWhereEverythere
Reviews.Content: Stayed in quite a small room but it was clean, comfortable and and fine. Didn't find any internet access though, which could have become problematic. Great value for money and good area.

Reviews.Title: “perfect stay in friendly boutique hotel in a real parisian neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: karileed
Reviews.Content: i went w/ my husband and 81 year old grandma ... hotel so cute .. clean and freindly and even though we constantly tried to use our french 101 the staff helped us w/ their proficient english (we still tried our french) ... we used to always stay in the Bastille area but no more ....we will always stay at this hotel not only for its charm but for the charming little neighborhood of real working class parisians, in the morning we would open our shutters to see everyone bustling through the stree for work and the school children chattering, at night we could walk to several restaurants at the little town square equipped w/ a couple park benches and a their very own fountain...very close walking distance to metro ... at one end of stree could see the steeples of sacre le cour...we would buy wine and cheese at our corner sotre and kept in our room's kitchenette and late afternoons before a quick 'chat' nap we would take a glass of wine a bit of cheese and go into the hotels small atrirum ... i could go on and on ....

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: longtimetravellers
Reviews.Content: We booked for 5 nights, a superior room, arrived and got a crappy standard room and we couldn't even sit on the toilet. I know room space is a premium in Paris but this was ridiculous. Moved to another room, still not superior, asked for a taxi to be ordered and was told no they are all to busy and we will "Have to take the Metro". This guy did not even try. Thank God there was a Best Western down the road, lost some money but at least we were treated better and could sleep. Nice location but overpriced and over rated. Would not recommend anyone stay here

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: samtaz
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel randomly on the tripadvisor website and I got lucky. It is very well located with beautiful French shops and cafes nearby. A short walk to the Sacre-coer cathedral. A fair hike(25 mins) to the river Seine but if you're up for a walk and enjoy taking in the local culture then well worth it. It is easily walkable from the Gare de Nord railway station(10 mins if you have a map). Paris is beautiful for sightseeing and museums etc but very, very expensive!! I was told that our hotel was close to the red light area which is true but it is outside that area and you can easily avoid it if you want to. The staff were few but very polite and helpful. They were happy to speak English. Our room was cleaned regularly and was very nice and comfortable. There is a small, outdoor, enclosed quiet area which is beautifully decorated with flowers, ideal for reading or resting. Overall a little hidden gem that I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and very clean”
Reviews.Author: LondonGlenn65
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a two night short break. It is very clean and serves as a great base for sightseeing. Montmarte is within easy walking distance as is the Gare du Nord (15 mins). The area is very safe and quiet with lots of nice coffee shops, bars and restaurants. The staff were very helpful although we didn't eat in the restuarant due to the local cafes etc. The St George metro station is just around the corner. I would recommend this as a good place to explore from.

Reviews.Title: “A very special 40th wedding anniversary”
Reviews.Author: flloyd80
Reviews.Content: We spent a short time in Paris 40 years ago on our honeymoon and visited again a couple of years ago, stayng at this hotel for the first time. To celebrate our 40th anniversary we stayed again last week. The hotel upgraded our room and were very thoughtful and considerate throughout our stay, particularly the young gentlemen on reception who greeted us on arrival and who was so helpful to us each afternoon The hotel is very clean and has a great location. We loved our stay at the hotel and would thoroughly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: gilespotter
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, reasonably priced (perhaps we got a special deal at 100 € per night), the staff were friendly and I thought it was perfectly located. It's ona quiet street but there's a small square nearby with a couple of cafes and a Velib stand, it's close to the metro St Georges and less than 5 minutes to walk up to Pigalle metro and Montmartre beyond, or 10 minutes downhill to Galleries Lafayette and Printemps for Parisian department store shopping. I'd definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Quiet, sufficiently roomy and very close to Metro”
Reviews.Author: CJayDJ
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews I expected an incredibly tiny room so was pleasantly surprised to find that, yes it was small, but perfectly formed. It really was sufficient as we spent most of our time out of the room. Our bathroom was actually reasonably spacious so overall we were very pleased. Everything was very clean and we had no complaints. We had a view of the inner courtyard so the only minor point we had was that when the windows were open in the morning cigarette smoke wofts in from the early risers having their coffee and smoke but this really is a minor minor point. We picked this hotel because we hoped it would be quiet being away from all the hustle and bustle and it was. It was a good bit pricier than we had budgeted for but it was worth it for the location, the cleanliness and the quiet. There are several restaurants at the end of the street and several cafes at the other end. It is very close to St George's Metro stop, say 2 mins, and about 10 mins from Pigalle so we were very pleased as the hotel is very well situated. Whilst the hotel is quite close to Pigalle and Moulin Rouge, you can be assured that there are no sex shops in the immediate area of the hotel - you only see them when you start walking towards Pigalle and you don't see them for at least 2 or 3 blocks so don't worry about that in the slightest - even when you do walk past them they are discreet so there is nothing to be uncomfortable about. We arrived on a Saturday and expected to find the local area quite busy but the area didn't appear to stir until about 11am and fully awoke on Tuesday so there was a lovely mid week vibe. There is an indian restaurant at the end of the street on the corner, however, if you walk past it up to the right you find another indian tucked away called the New Anarkali that is cheaper - the food is delicious, plentiful and the owner is very friendly. Go mid-week when there are more customers or go when there are no customers and the owner gives you a free pint to keep you on.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish but affordable”
Reviews.Author: cph24
Reviews.Content: Boutique-style hotel in the 9th Arondissement. My girlfriend and I liked it a lot, we appreciated having a bigger than normal bathroom for Paris (which means pretty small anywhere else) and we liked the location too on a hill roughly 10 to 15 mins walk away from the Opera House. We actually took our baggage downhill by foot to catch the airport bus and that worked out ok, the local metro station (St Georges)– like most of them only has stairs but only two flights to get up! The neighbourhood was pleasant with good cafes, boulangeries and a good cheese shop close by.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy hotel in a nice quiet neighborhood close to the metro.”
Reviews.Author: mooresf
Reviews.Content: A great no frills small hotel in a nice Paris neighborhood. The metro stop was extremely close (1-2 minute easy walk). The room was small with an extremely tiny shower, but overall a great place to stay. You get to experience the feel of a local neighborhood, but still have easy access to all of the tourist attractions on the metro. Safe neighborhood with lots of restaurants and bakeries. An easy to use laundry mat was located 1 block away.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable,clean,easy metro access,hospitable”
Reviews.Author: EurotravelJBH
Reviews.Content: Excellent service. Breakfast available. Only disappointment was their recommendation for a tour company. They recommended a tour company that they were comfortable with rather than what was best for us and backed up the company when we requested a partial refund for expenses not incurred by the company. Planet City was definitely more expensive and did not provide fast track entrance nor complete english and very cramped travel seating. Other than that, it was an excellent clean hotel, wonderful restaurants and patisseries nearby, as well as close to the metro.

Reviews.Title: “LE TROIS POUSSINS HOTEL PARIS, THE 3 POUSSINS PARIS”
Reviews.Author: daztheworldtraveller
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay a the Trois Poussins hotel. Just me and the wife on a romantic get away for 4 days. Ideal location for people who hate to be a part of the hectic and false tourist image of Paris or anywhere for that matter. The Room we had was of a good size, decent bathroom and we had a fridge and cooking area (that we never asked for). The room also had a small wardrobe with a safe. The room has a small LCD tv and you can get CNN, BBC World and Eurosport in english. The rooms were cleaned daily to a very good standard with the toiletries always being topped up and towels changed. The staff were very helpful and never short of a smile and whilst not all of the staff speak fluent English they will do their up most to help out. The breakfast is a typical euro style affair with coissants, pain au chocolat, bread, cheese meats etc etc and is served down in the basement by a pleasant African lady. And please don't be affraid to ask for more if it's not there. The Main foyer is clean and pleasant with seating. You can also pick up a free English paper (the Guardian). Out the back is a small courtyard were you can also sit to have breakfast. So to sum up the Hotel: My wife and I wished for a nice clean hotel in a quiet area near to some typical french restaurants and bars but at the same time not having to rob a bank to pay for it. The Trois Poussins fits the bill, we never wanted a hotel to stay in all day just one that would act as a pit stop for our exploration of Paris. The hotel is near the centre of Paris and is a stones throw from the Moulin Rouge and Sacre Couer. The area around the hotel is nice and relaxed, it has some nice places to eat and have a drink and a few nice shops to have look around. The Opera district is only a few minutes walk away which has even more places to eat and shop. The St Georges Metro is about 150m away and you can also get a bus (No 74) into the central shopping district of Les Halles. Finally: We only stayed for 4 days and to tell you the truth we didn't really go near any of the tourist trap areas of Paris. We sat in cafes, eat in restaurants and had a look in old shops for stuff you wouldn't get in Britian. You can eat and drink reasonably cheaply if you are bold have a bit of bottle and go to the places that the Pariseans go. I arrived at the airport talking French like Inspector Clouseau I didn't come away any better! However I tried and the French respected that (at the same time as laughing at my accent) and helped out. Treat yourself to some great food and drink and not the tourist tat and save money doing it. After all your worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great family room for paris, good location”
Reviews.Author: FamilyOE_10
Reviews.Content: This was a very good hotel for the family. Better than expected. Breakfast was very good and their was good places to eat close by that the hotel recommended. Close to the underground so easy to get around the city. Friendly staff, The children thought this was the "Best Hotel"

Reviews.Title: “Good value, clean, good location.”
Reviews.Author: seizetheday52
Reviews.Content: Its taken 6 months to write the review, not something I would normally do but as i sit here reminising over the holiday/work trip I thought they deserve feedback. When I found out I was going to Uk for a weeks work and had the opportunity of adding annual leave we googled Paris hotels from Australia. We had been told rooms in Paris hotels were small and expensive by friends, we were concerned. So many hotels on the net and settled on this one based on trip advisor comments. it was a gamble that paid off. First the hotel... polite and informative front desk,small lift, for us a good sized room on 4th floor (we asked for the one in the pic on website - yellow walls) and got it, really good, ensuite a bit small but perfectly OK. A short taxi ride from Gard de Nord (10Euro) and an Ok street, (hidden school across the road and petrol station 100mts up the road that you'd never even notice unless you look hard enough) great cafe aptly named No Stress Cafe at the end of the street for typically French food/wine, great service, full of locals. Suggest you get a map as streets arent in typical blocks, we went for an evening walk and got a bit lost. Find the local metro at St Georges and Paris is yours. train to asemblee national, museum D'Orsay then walk along the river to Eiffel tower, over the river to the trocedero, lunch local lunch bar and on to arc de triumph...traffic at arc de triumph is funny, sit and watch it. Other places to go... Sacre cour in walking distance, (tip) If you go there walk round the back and see the artisan market, we went all the way from Australia, saw the view and didnt even know what was round the back - didnt find that out until we got back here and saw the artist square on a holiday programme. corner. Rather than take a gamble on something else and short of spending HEAPS on a predictable 5 star place we would go to this hotel again. any questions... seizetheday52@hotmail.com Peter and Lisa November 12th -14th 2009.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Deborah B
Reviews.Content: My friend and I really enjoyed our stay at the hotel. It's just a short distance by taxi from Gare du Nord - we probably could have walked. The receptionist was very helpful on arrival and our room was just what we needed for a one night visit. Very clean. Is very close to Sacre Coeur - and there's lots of cafes and restaurants close by.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel a little out of the way”
Reviews.Author: AmericanTourista889
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay at the hotel. It was very clean and the rooms were pretty nice. Our floor had a balcony attached to each window and the bathrooms were a great size. The location is in a cute area and you would never know how close you are to the Red Light District. The metro is just around the corner but not part of a central line-- very good if you don't mind a few changes.... Disney is about an hour + away. The Italian restaurant around the corner was fantastic and we enjoyed our walk to Sacre Couer. There is no air conditioning so I don't know how it would be in hot weather and internet is a separate fee per day. All in all we really enjoyed the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Little Find in Paris!!!”
Reviews.Author: darcijw1
Reviews.Content: I spent HOURS of research trying to find a reasonably priced hotel, in a great location, in Paris and my research definitely paid off! This little hotel was a GREAT find! About 3 short blocks from the Saint Georges metro stop and a few short steps from a couple GREAT little cafes.....who could ask for more? We walked to the Sacre Coeur & Monmartre (about a 15 minute walk) and not far from the Moulin Rouge or Gare du Nord. If you venture onto the next block, you will find several patisseries and other food shops as well as a variety of specialty boutiques. A nice neighborhood feel.....definitley NOT touristy at all (which is a bonus in my book!). We were lucky enough to stay in the handicapped room, which was on the main level (no need for the "lift") which was attached to the "garden" area. A very spacious room (intended for 3 people with a single and a queen size bed) and bathroom. The staff spoke English (as my French consists of about 20 words.....most of them food items) and were kind enough to offer directions, call a cab or make arrangements for a shuttle to take us to the airport upon our departure (MUCH less expensive than a cab). We loved our stay at this hotel and would DEFINITELY stay again! I found the best deal on hotels.com.....(and again, I did A LOT of research). Have fun and au revoir!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: jetsetter76
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Les 3 Poussins hotel for 8 nights and have enjoyed my stay very much. It is not located in the touristy area and very close to 3 metro stops with Saint George being the closest. There are many cafes, bakeries and small grocery stores nearby. It is also in a safe neighborhood. I never felt unsafe walking alone at night. This hotel is located within walking distance to the Opera, Lafayette and Printemps department stores, Theater Mogador (Lion King), Monmartre (Sacre Coeur) and the red light district. The Louvre is about 20-30 minutes away by foot. The lobby of the hotel is very charming. The people at the front desk are helpful and friendly. I stayed in a tiny single room in the attic and it was very charming. The only thing I did not like is how small the bathroom is. I am not a very big person (106 lbs, 5'2" tall ) and I had difficulty sitting on the toilet as there is not much room between the toilet and the wall. If you are big and tall, this probably won't work for you. The water pressure is good, however, the shower stall is also very tiny. I kept turning off the water with my elbows by accident as there is not much room to move around at all. New towels are replaced daily if you put old ones on the floor. My sheets only got changed once the entire time I was there. Insulation is also not very good. You can hear the traffic outside and the squeaky elevator if you have a room next to it. I couldn't hear the people next to me, only the people stomping above me. If you bring earplugs you should be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff + Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: pnathan
Reviews.Content: Jennifer and Jose at the front desk were very friendly and very helpful. They made our stay at the hotel enjoyable and provided us with great advice about where to go, eat, what to do, etc. We really loved the surrounding neighborhood because it is not in a very "touristy" area. We enjoyed the local cafes, boutiques, bakeris and so on. It was nice to feel like a part of a very real parisian neighborhood. At the same time, we were within walking distance of the Opera and Galeries Lafayette. There's a metro very close by which makes it easy to get to anyplace in the city very quickly. We felt very safe in this neighborhood. The room was clean, quiet, and pretty. We look forward to coming back again. Hopefully sooner than later.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: muggsieshoop
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I loved our stay so much at the 3 Poussins. It was clean and beautiful. We felt as if we were in a very posh hotel without paying the price for one. The location if perfect as well with many shops and restaurants near by but also away from the busy streets and noise. The staff was also very friendly and accomodating. I will be back when I return to Paris and I would recommend it to any and all of my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for short business or leisure stay”
Reviews.Author: eurostar49
Reviews.Content: We were attracted to this hotel as it had a customer review rating of 4.4 and as it was located in a quiet street yet near St. George metro and local cafes/restaurants. The hotel was immaculate although, as other reviewes have mentioned, bedrooms are on the small side. It is within easy walking distance of Sacre Coeur, Opera Garnier and the shopping area at Boulevard Haussman. We found the area adjacent to the hotel to be perfectly safe and we would be happy to stay there in the future. Great patisseries and cheese shops on Rue des Martyrs. Tip: We found the best value for money breakfast was to be had at the slightly dingy cafe on the corner of the road.

Reviews.Title: “will definitely stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: Ohassan
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 6 nights from 5th to 11th of march 2010 with my husband and 2.5 years old son, amazing hotel, great location, just opposite St.George metro station, 5 min walk from Pegal station, very clean and tidy room, small toilet but was enough for us with shower, lots of restaurants and dinning places around, staff are very good spicially Ms. Jennifer, she is the best, super friendly and helpful the only thing is that elevator is too small but it was not a big deal for us.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & well placed hotel”
Reviews.Author: NorthernRebelSTFC
Reviews.Content: A well kept hotel, about 15 minutes walk from Gare du Nord and 30 minutes or so from the Louvre/River. The room was very clean and comfortable, not huge, but spacious enough. Decent sized bathroom with a bath & shower. Some traffic noise came to the 3rd floor through the double glazing (random horn barping in the small hours), but the street was reasonably quiet. Just around the corner was a street with a real village feel - fishmongers, cheese shops & cafes and some good bars/restaurants so we didn't need to go into the centre of town for food.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Staff, and Location”
Reviews.Author: ronlieb51
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the pleasure of staying at the Les Trois Poussins the second time this month, our stay was for ten-days.. We stayed at the hotel in January, 2009 for 10-days. The staff as we expected was professional and very friendly to us. Over the years, we've traveled throughout Europe and the staff has made us want to return to Paris. The rooms were clean, roomy, and having a kitchenette was more of a pleasure considering the many pastry and cheese shops along the Rue Des Martrys. Another advantage for staying at the hotel is the convenient transportation connections through the Paris Metro (the station is called 'Saint-Georges'). My wife and I are considering a third trip to Paris next year, and part of the reason for returning to Paris is the friendly atmosphere at the Les Trois Poussins.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean room in a charming location”
Reviews.Author: LosAngelesShopgirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there during Thanksgiving week. We were pleasantly surprised. The breakfast was typical European style and very cute. The room was clean. The furnitures are kind of old, but not a big deal. It is very close to the Metro, which was the best way to travel within Paris anyway. You got to try the nice little restaurant right down the street called Caffe Jasdis, on rue Notro Dame de Lorette. The food was excellent and the price was reasonable as well.

Reviews.Title: “A little piece of Heaven”
Reviews.Author: smkmd
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my recent trip to Paris, but the best part was coming home to the Les Trois Poussins Hotel each night. The staff is so courteous and helpful, the room was very tidy and esthetically pleasing, beds were very comfortable, bathrooms were up to date and sparkling white. We would recommend this hotel wholeheartedly!!! Plus we were close to restaurants and bistros, the metro, bus lines!!

Reviews.Title: “A nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: MidwesternGirl77797
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a long weekend recently and found the hotel to be very nice. Small tidy rooms were clean. The extensive continental breakfast was included, which is rare in Paris and served in the vaulted basement dining room. Close to two Metro stops - we actually found Lorette more convienent than St George - and a 15 minute walk to the Grand Boulevards. A quiet location but just off of the Rue des Martyr with all of it's foodie shops. Service was friendly and helpful and they even delivered breakfast to our room for my husband's birthday one morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great, convenient, friendly, and nice price”
Reviews.Author: chrislw77
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel because it was not too far out and it was a great price. First, it is still in Zone 1 which means you can get an all day train pass from the nearby underground metro train station. Also, it is in walking distance to plenty of good restaurants, bakeries, and banks. The staff was very friendly and accomodating. I would try to speak French and they would answer the phone in English when I called. The internet is not free, but it isn't bad either. The only complain I have is that my room was probably the only room with poor reception for the wireless. Most of the hotel has a very strong signal that I was in. I didn't use the restaurant, but I liked the option to have breakfast in the morning. I generally just walked to the local bakery. The cost of the hotel is less than most in Paris and with easy access to the train, I prefer the out of the way hotel. The area was quiet and nice to walk around in. I walked to further areas and felt very safe. Although I was alone, I would love to take the person I love to this spot and enjoy the life of Paris and the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect first Paris visit experience!”
Reviews.Author: BrisbaneBrad
Reviews.Content: My first trip to Paris was made perfect by my stay at Les Trois Poussins Hotel! The hotel was an easy walk from the Eurostar train, and the staff were all fantastically friendly and spoke English very well. I asked for a courtyard room, which they arranged on the first floor. The room was fantastic for the price I paid (I got a cheap deal through the Eurostar booking website). It was very clean, and the bed was very comfortable. The inclusion of a room safe made me feel a lot safer to leave my things behind when I went out. Air conditioning was also great to have, as even in October, the weather in Paris was steamy! The location of the hotel is superb. It is in a quiet little street away from the tourist areas, and there are plenty of well priced shops and restaurants in the streets nearby, open until late. The metro (St Georges station) is only a few minutes walk. Pigalle station is also less than 5 minutes walk away. I did not have breakfast in the hotel, but I heard it was excellent, although expensive. There are many cafes nearby that serve excellent food and coffee. I can highly recommend the breakfast at Le Select on Rue des Martyrs - I had breakfast there every morning, and the waiter remembered my coffee order after the first day! The hotel also has WiFi internet, which isn't included in the room cost, but the best deal is to buy 30 minute blocks for 50 cents each. They just give you a password for each 30 minute block. I think you can buy unlimited 24 hour usage for 4Euro Dollars. I highly recommend this hotel for a stay in Paris, and I'll certainly be back!

Reviews.Title: “What fun we had!”
Reviews.Author: jevoudrais
Reviews.Content: Though just a bit to far for walking to sites it is well situated for the Metro. The best thing about the hotel is the wonderful staff, lovely and helpful in every way. The rooms are clean, comfortable, and large for Paris. Our room even had a frig. The courtyard and breakfast room are a pleasure. I can recommend the hotel without hesitation...just a bit far out from the 1st A.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable ,clean, convenient and has a very helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Alice62
Reviews.Content: Great value for money. I couldn't fault this hotel in any way. It is near the Metro and there are a lot of restaurants nearby. The staff are exceptionally helpful and wecoming.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Wildlilac
Reviews.Content: We always try different hotels in different locations when visiting Paris. This hotel is a short walk to the Basilique du Sacre Coeur, the Saint-Georges or the Le Peletier metro stop or even to the Opera area. The room that we stayed in was actually quite spacious (and we had two huge Samsonite suitcase!) and clean. It is bright and did not smell at all. The bathroom on the other hand was quite small but clean. Fresh towels are provided everyday. The are two lady receptionist, and they both speak English. And if you want to practice your French or need any assistance in finding restaurants or places to shop, they are more than happy to help you. Breakfast is in the basement. I think it was about 13 Euros per person but it has quite a good selection to fill you up until lunch time arrives. There is a tiny courtyard where you can sit to read a book or have a drink. There is an elevator next to the check-in desk. There is Wi-Fi but you have to pay for it. It is not that expensive and you have to get the password from the desk (it is only valid for 24-hours). There are grocery stores, cheese shop, fruit shop and pastry store nearby. Would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: Michaelaww
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel for the price. It is very clean and well presented. It is situated on a quiet road close to Montmartre. The staff were very helpful and even offered to try and book some restaurants we were interested in. The room was serviced to a high standard every day. The breakfast was fine and what we expected. OK you may be able to get something for better value nearby, but we were happy with the convenience of popping downstairs. The room itself was good. The bed wasn't the biggest in the world, but it was all quite new and the bathroom was actually quite spacious compared to some hotels I have stayed in. There are no tea/coffee facilities in the room, but I think this could be the case with many Paris hotels. It is very handy for the St George metro stop which is useful for getting in to the centre of town. Montmartre is also a short walk away and you can quite easily spend a day there wondering around as we did. Top tip for a nearby restaurant is Le Jardinier - awesome, about 20 mins walk from the hotel. Overall wouldn't hesitate to use Les Trois Poussins again, great!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, helpful friendly staff at a budget price!”
Reviews.Author: pretzel65
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay in Paris - a quiet street in the heart of Montmartre, near the St Georges Metro station, it is everything a budget traveller would want - convenient location, friendly staff, great local neighbourhood for shopping, good reasonably priced restaurants nearby. The room was great - we got a great rate compared to the advertised one, and a beautiful view - the same as from the Sacre Coeur church! Ask for a top floor room if you want to pay just a little extra. We booked online - no problems. Location - as previously mentioned, just a few mins walk from St Georges metro, close to local grocery shops and boutiques, a walk up the hill to the Sacre Coeur. The hotel was lovely - clean, with helpful friendly staff. Breakfast was continental, not great value but fresh bread and lovely cheeses. We would recommend looking around at the great bakeries/patisseries nearby if you want some good options for breakfast/lunch. What we liked best was that it was small, quiet, and close to transport etc. Just a 10 min walk up the road is all the Montmartre nightlife like Moulin Rouge. What we like least? Nothing!!! I could live here, it was so lovely.

Reviews.Title: “A Charming and Comfortable Experience”
Reviews.Author: Linda1949
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I enjoyed an 8 night stay at this lovely hotel. We were very pleased with the accommodations and the cleanliness of the hotel. We arrived mid-morning and were exhausted from travel. They gave us our room immediately much to our surprise and pleasure! The room had a king bed and a chair that pulled out into a bed. It also included a mini kitchen area. We only used the counter space and the refrigerator, however for a fee, they will let you use the stove top. As my husband had to cancel at the last minute and since I had paid for a triple, our accommodations were great for two. It would have been a very tight space for 3 people and since I had asked to have accommodations for 3 adults and no pull out beds, I was surprised that the third bed was a chair with a pull out bed. As it was, we were only 2; so no problem with this. The neighborhood was adorable and we were around few tourists. This was a definate bonus for us as in June the city is full of them. Every where we went we were dining with the locals. It is a nice neighborhood and since we were two single women we moved around with ease and no discomfort about our safety. Several nice restaurants in the area and the St. George metro is about a block away for easy access to the many sights. It only takes about 10 minutes to go anywhere. Some of the sights are very close by and it is pleasant to walk around too. Many boutiques, bakeries, grocery stores, produce markets, cheese markets, and food or wine stores a block away. A great treat is on Sunday they close the street off 1/2 block away for a market. Well dressed locals stroll about with their children getting their food purchases in a leisurely manner. This street is the Rue de Martyrs. The people working at the hotel were delightful except for one man who was business like but not particularily friendly. Not really a problem as we only saw him two times. The breakfast is a bit pricy for what they serve, but very convenient. We usually ate from the refrigerator and only had coffee at the hotel. The courtyard is adorable and a nice place to enjoy that coffee. A great experience overall. My only suggestion is to check your bill prior to checkout for accuracy. Our room was pre-paid, but there were many breakfasts on our bill that we did not order. I suspect this was due to the lack of English skills of the woman who was in the breakfast area. I would show her two fingers and point to the coffee. I think she thought I meant 2 breakfasts and two coffees. The desk had the real records as I always told the clerk what I planned to have and as a result this was remedied. It did take a bit of time, though, about 30 minutes to rectify. We loved this hotel and would definately enjoy another visit!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Quiet, Comfy Bed, Very Small Room”
Reviews.Author: ChiWind
Reviews.Content: I booked my five night stay in mid-April (2009) asking for a room on garden side vs street side but did not get that. My very small room faced the street but it did not prevent my peaceful sleep. I was allowed to check in after an early morning arrival in Paris as my room was ready. I was able to take a needed nap immediately so I was not about to complain that there was no refrigerator as I had anticipated. The bed was very comfortable, and I am very fussy about bed comfort. The bed linens were good, the towels not that great but acceptable, as I recall. There was no chair in the small room, and I like to be able to sit and read for a bit and organize/plan my day. There was no clearance in the bathroom for my knees, if you get my drift! Lovely receptionist works at this hotel and I apologize that I cannot recall her name at this point. Yeah, the guys are not all that ready to display hospitality but they were there when needed. Yes, location is good if you are going to be using metro but I do not like being crowded in a sardine can underground. I did most of my sightseeing as a walker. It was challenging and not as easy as some other reviewer led me to believe. It takes longer to get to the Louvre, Eiffel Tower, Invalides, etc. than 20 minutes unless you have very long legs or gait! It is also a tad challenging to work out a street that will take you directly south toward the river, but I did find a favored route. I would tell you the street names, but they change as you go along so I don't want to confuse another poor soul. Eventually I broke down and bought carnet (10 tickets, about $15 US Dollars) and took metro to various sites because I was running out of Advil to relieve the leg and foot pain at end of day. I am very happy I did as much walking as I did because it really acquainted me with the city and its very different neighborhoods. Since I cannot afford 13 Euro breakfasts I have no report on that. ALSO be forewarned that the grocery store up the street, Champion, does not open until 9 am. So that does not work for yogurt in the morning when you have no fridge. I am an early bird, so I had to adjust to the "sleepier" mode of Paris. I managed to eat a couple salads I concocted with items from Champion at the table in the room sitting on the suitcase stool. By US standards and US dollars, none of these space issues would be acceptable, but it's not their fault that the exchange rate is what it is. I was also offered option to leave my suitcase at checkout so I could continue sightseeing on my last day in Paris before taking an evening train to Florence. I appreciated that! There is a lobby sitting area if you need to sit and read during a rainstorm (as I did). I really enjoyed going up to Sacre Coeur on a Friday evening - very convenient location to hotel - and I got to sit down inside and listen to the nuns sing at 6 pm. What lovely sweet voices! Outside on the steps were hordes of people - families and couples - listening to some pretty good "street musician music." You can use your metro ticket to get up the hill and down the hills in the funicular (one apiece each way) if you are not up for the steep climb. I would give this hotel more stars for cleanliness but for the stained carpet that made you wonder when the last steam cleaning took place. Bring slippers. If you want similar price and spacious room with marble bath with shower and tub you can stay at the CDG airport at the Paris Hilton where I stayed my last night after a 6 week trip through various countries. IF YOU DO THIS...be warned that you need to bring food with you to the hotel as their restaurant is outrageously priced. But they have a big hotel that needs to be filled and there is free shuttle that runs between hotel and airport so you can take that over to the airport to eat. Also the train from the airport to the city will cost you more and you won't get the Paris neighborhood vibe. But - it's an option if you want a luxurious room with sofa and and nice bathroom same price range PLUS a full breakfast buffet included.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Northern_Girl_9
Reviews.Content: Having stayed here before and found the hotel and location excellent we decided to book another short stay yet this time it did not live up to my expectations. The room was small (which we expected and suited us) and the view was not spectacular (again something that didn't bother us as this was just a place to sleep). The positives about this hotel are that it is in a quiet location, clean and suitable for a short stay. However bewarned that there is a an additional charge for use of the kitchenette (cooker + microwave) which is obscurely marked on the back of the room door. Bathroom - small and in need of some TLC, particularly grout around one loose tile. Breakfast - didn't feel that the breakfast justified spending 13 euros so we got breakfast food/croissants locally instead. There are also local restuarants/cafes who offer a english/continental breakfast for 8.50 euros. Nighttime - the bed was too hard for me. Waking with a stiff back and bruised hip each morning was far from ideal. - the room was far too hot...then later too cold so several times I woke to cool down/warm up. - there was a regular clanking in our room during the night, perhaps related to the hot water system Staff - twice there was no one on reception so we had to wait for our keys - a member of staff was rude when my husband couldn't find where they had put our case on departure day. It turned out that the case hadn't been put where it should have been but no apology was made. Really didn't want to be critical of this hotel as we have stayed there previously and enjoyed our stay. Not really sure why our stay was so markedly different to previous, perhaps it was just this particular room had problems.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in the centre of paris”
Reviews.Author: TonyRay
Reviews.Content: Good location, Nice room although bit small, reception spoke English, Breakfeast was good. Overall a very nice hotel to stay in paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, will recommend but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: LindylouWinchester
Reviews.Content: Just returned yesterday from a 3 night stay. Firstly the hotel is in a great location 4 mins walk to St George metro and also a very short walk to the Pigelle area of Montmarte. The room was small but very adequate and the bed comfortable, very good for Paris. We found the room got quite hot at night and the large windows would only open fully so we could not let fresh air in for any length of time as too cold for March and the air conditioning although set really low did not seem to cool us very much. But this aside we were otherwise very happy with our room. The breakfast was pretty costly so we only had this on the last morning of our stay for convenience, but otherwise ate it at local cafes. We are very friendly people who get on well with most but we did find one of the recepiton staff to be particulary unfriendly, compounded by one occasion after a long day pounding the streets we requested tea as offered in the room menu. My Husband even went to reception to save him bringing it up to our room to request it and was greeted with a Humprh!!! any teenager would be proud of as the gentleman in question was not happy at being disturbed doing something on his laptop.
