Not quite what you would expect at any hotel. All in all I would recommend this hotel to anyone for location price and comfort. I just think that one member of staff could do with some training in hospitallity. Fortunately other members of staff were much friendlier.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel....lives up to all the great reviews”
Reviews.Author: deltaz91
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights 20-21 March. We booked a triple room and we were located on the 6th (european) floor of the hotel. Our room was the length of the hotel, with a large queen size bed and closet on one end, a large chair/tv and table with 4 chairs in the middle, then a twin bed a kitchenette and large bathroom on the other end. The 6 large windows all had black out blinds (which my hubby appreciated). We could even see the top of the Sacre Coure from half of our windows. The check in and out was very simple and the staff were very nice. The area was all I wanted and more and not a bit touristy. We met a nice British man that had lived there with his French wife for 26 years and he commented that we were staying in the perfect area...."real Paris" as he called it! I couldn't agree more!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel for a short break in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Boughtonfields
Reviews.Content: We stayed at LesTrois Poussins for a long weekend in March 2009. The hotel is in an excellent position. Located 10-15 min walk from the rail station (Gare Du Nord) in a quiet street. The staff were welcoming and helpful (and speak English if your French isn't good!) Our room was small but clean & fresh smelling with a good sized en-suite. I don't expect that other rooms were any bigger as the building is typical Paris. If we'd stayed for longer the room may have felt a little cramped, but for our 4 nights it was perfect. My only critism of the room is typically English - there's no tea or coffee making facilities. The hotel is less than 5 min from the nearest metro station (St. Georges - turn left out of hotel, at the end of the road turn left, metro is 200yds) making it perfect for getting around Paris. If you like to walk it's approx 20min to the centre of Paris (Louvre, Notre-Dame) We didn't have breakfast in the hotel (thou it smelt lovely), but instead walked 2min to a cafe (left out of hotel, at end of road, cafe on right). Cost approx 7-10 euro, depending what you have. (hotel breakfast was 13 euro) There are also many resteraunts/bars within easy walking distance for lunch & dinner - almost too many to choose from! Overall I've rated Les Trois Poussins 5 star and I'll definately be staying again when back in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Xilonia
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed for three nights, and we checked in early. The reception and lobby looked immaculate and stylish, and showed that it was very well looked after. We checked in with the lady and she was very welcoming, and also our room was ready, at 13.00 which was great! We were lucky to be on a high floor, with lovely views. The room was small, but cosy and clean with a sun-drenched balcony. We had a kitchenette, and the fridge was extremely useful for storing water in (note - a small bottle of water can cost up to 3 Euros in most places, although the fruit and veg shop on the corner of the street sells large bottles for much less!). I needed an iron and board, which I called down for and they had one available, although I was quite surprised that I had to go all the way down stairs to collect it and lug it back to my room, then back down again a few minutes later - after 8 hours of travelling it would have been nice to have had it sent up to the room. The hotel also serves room service, and their menu looks lovely (we did not try room service), and is served until 2.30am, although be aware of the price - a selection of cheeses costs 19 Euros per person. The buffet breakfast is fantastic! I read somewhere to get there early for breakfast because it does not get replenished, but on our last day we decided to go down there at 9.30am (breakfast is from 7am-10am) and the buffet was even more full than before when we used to get there early! Very good selection, with cheeses (port salut, babybel), yoghurts, pastries (croissant, pain au raisin, pain au chocolate), fruit (yes from a tin, but tasted fine), cereals, orange juice, tea/coffee. Brilliant fuel food. The location is absolutely fantastic - for example we took the Saint Georges Metro to the Louvre (including a train change) and it only took 17 minutes! The Sacre Coeur and Montmartre is within walking distance, although be aware that it is uphill all the way, but fantastic when you get there. There are many boulangeries, patisseries and lovely cafes on the way, so it is a very pretty walk. Two things though; at the bottom of the Sacre Coeur there are a few people trying to sell bracelets, and they are very pushy so try to get to the steps/tram quickly or find an alternative way, secondly the artists in Montmartre square are eager to paint you, but ask them how much their fee is first as there are stories that people had to spend 100 Euros on their portrait because they didnt ask the price beforehand! We went to a nearby Bistro on a Monday (please note that many of the nicer restaurants recommended to us from the hotel are closed on Mondays) called Jadas (or similar spelling). It was a lovely little Bistro only a 5 minute walk from the hotel, and service was very warm and friendly, highly recommended. The check out was very friendly, and we were able to store our luggage at reception for a few hours. Overall, this hotel has exceeded most expectations, and we would not hesitate to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, safe location with exceptional service, close to transport”
Reviews.Author: reneeaus
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on our honeymoon in November 2008. We absolutely loved this hotel. As soon as we arrived, we were greeted warmly by the friendly reception staff. They helped us by providing a map of the city and directions to local facilities such as bakery, convenience store, et cetera. They also booked our return airport transfer for us, which I thought was great. The staff members spoke both English and French, and were patient enough to let us practise our French when we wanted to. We had a studio room on the 3rd floor (307) which included a small kitchenette with stove, fridge, microwave, a sink for washing dishes, and enough cutlery to last us for the duration of our stay. We loved having a kitchenette as we were able to stock up the fridge with food from a local convenience store to save money on snacks and have breakfast in our room. Our room was immaculate and was serviced daily with fresh towels etc. There was great cupboard space too which came in handy. The hotel is located in a quiet, residential area and I felt safe walking around even late at night. The metro is very close, and is also a short walk from patisseries, cafes, butchers, deli and a little supermarket. There is a patisserie that makes the BEST chocolate eclairs that I have ever tasted - if you stay here you really have to try them! The nearest metro is St Georges. From here, it took us about 10-15 minutes on the metro to get into the main attractions (you have to change of trains at Concorde to get to the Louvre, Champs-Elysses etc). So, overall, it was a clean, comfortable hotel in a quiet and safe location that is convenient to shops and public transport. The warm and friendly staff were definitely a highlight of our stay here, and we would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, charming hotel and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Milonga
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 3 nights at this charming hotel. We read the reviews on tripadvisor before booking and we weren't disappointed. We had a room on the ground floor, which was much larger than we expected. In fact it had a spare single bed but still left us plenty of room to move around. The bathroom was bright, newly decorated and large. We asked for a quiet room and we certainly were accommodated in this. The staff were polite and extremely helpful. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel. We only eat a light breakfast and thought 10 Euros to eat at the hotel was quite alot. However, there are plenty of cafes in the area. I can particularly recommend The No Stress Cafe at the top of the street. We've discovered it's acceptable to take your own croissants/cakes in to a cafe if they don't serve any. No exception here.There is a delightful baker around the corner in the opposite direction so you are well catered for. The hotel is situated in the Saint Georges district, a really characterful calm area, five minutes from the Metro. It's central enough to walk to more central areas if you want. This is an ideal place to come back to after a hard day's sightseeing. I'd thoroughly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice and a good basis for a short visit to Paris”
Reviews.Author: Laverda82
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay in this Hotel. Although the room and the bathroom was really small, everything was clean and nice. The bathroom was not really state of the art, but I did not expect that for this price. The bedroom was nicely decorated. The entrance and the breakfast room are really beautiful and the service was also very friendly. We can really recommend this hotel for a short trip as it is located near to the Metro and to the Montmartre.

Reviews.Title: “First trip to Paris -wonderful location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: citylover0
Reviews.Content: Had a fantastic time in Paris - hotel was excellent and thanks to previous reviews found some fantastic places to eat that don't cost the earth - would recommend Sizin the Turkish restaurant and Le Charlain both excellent - No stress cafe just at the end of the street was okay for a drink but my main meal was not up to scratch - maybe I was just unlucky. Walked all over Paris and the location of this hotel is just 10 mins from Sacre Coeur with amazing view. Very impressed with the Louvre (visit in Jan - no crowds). Boat trip on the Seine was excellent and Eiffel Tower good (only went to second level). I will definitely return to Paris and would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Cillban
Reviews.Content: Just back from a long weekend in Paris with my mum and sister. We booked the hotel after reading favourable reviews on tripadvisor and we were not dissapointed. It is a small family run hotel in a great location. Absolutely no noise from traffic,extremely clean, and only a 10 min walk to Montmartre/Sacre Coeur and 10 mins in the other direction to Galleries Lafayette. Three metro staions all very close by for exploring further afield. Also we had the most fabulous meals in two restaurants close by which we would not have found unless staying in this lovely area. The names are Le Charlain (a french restaurant) and Fuxia (an italian restaurant) and beacuse they are not on the main tourist streets were far from overpriced. the only minor complaint I would have is there was no tourist information booklet/folder in our room so be well read or a pay a visit to the tourist office. Will definitely be recommending this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, value for money”
Reviews.Author: fly_ebos
Reviews.Content: We just came back from an excellent stay at the 3 Poussins. Before arriving, I emailed them to ask for the easiest way to get there from the train station. I got a quick and detailled reply. We arrived early in the morning, and our room was still occupied. They took our luggage in storage and suggested a visit to the nearby Sacre-Coeur and Montmarter area. By 13h, the room was ready as promised. As this is Paris, don't except ballroom size rooms! We had enough space to put our suitcase on the ground, and still move around safely, so it was ok. Breakfast, which was included in our price they told me at checkout, was good. Some patries, croissant, cheese, yoghurt... but nothing hot. Maybe some boiled eggs would have been nice In the area around the hotel there is plenty places to eat. We could recommend the 'No stress cafe' and the Tea Place, close to the hotel. If you want an excellent dinner, go to Bistro la Lorette, we had a 3 course dinner there for 30 euros. But do make reservations on Sathurday nights!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: weloveParisEngland
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter & I stayed here for 4 nights. Room 603- spacious by Parisien standards, clean & complete with roof terrace with amazing views! The weather was still warm enough to sit out in the morning with a croissant & coffee and again in the evening with a glass of wine. The eiffel tower can be seen twinkling at night in almost its entirety. The hob in our room was unused (there are too many fab eateries in Paris to even contemplate cooking!) and the full size fridge was wonderful for keeping drinks cold. The staff are wonderful and the hotel location makes it easy to grab the metro and travel anywhere. We love Paris (6th trip in 20 months) and were not disappointed with our hotel choice this time.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: BuggsLondon
Reviews.Content: A cost effective option booked through Eurostar (one of the cheapest 3 star options) informed by previous reviews on Tripadvisor. Better than my previous Paris hotel experiences. Our room was a reasonable size with a small self-catering area with an electric hob and full size refrigerator. (although no evidence of any cutlery, saucepans or crockery) but the extra space was good for storing the cases. The whole place felt very clean and efficient. Breakfast was an option at 10 euros and whilst no cooked items, it was more convenient than finding somewhere else to eat. The area was great, easy to find, only a short walk from St Georges or Pigalle Metro and in a very quiet backstreet away from the seedy areas, but within close enough touch to enjoy the character of Pigalle & Montmartre.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: siralex1
Reviews.Content: rooms clean though on the small side. breakfast dreadful and 11 euros extra on the price. do not pay it. industrial bread in the centre of paris, buffet was empty at 9am. service zero.

Reviews.Title: “Makes you love Paris”
Reviews.Author: redbaron55
Reviews.Content: Spent five wonderful days at this hotel and enjoyed greatly. Close to many restaurants and near Sacre Coueur and Moulin Rouge. Very Parisian. Room was always clean and continental breakfast great. What really made it superior were the desk staff. Two alternating young ladies that served as the greeter/ concierge. Tried to accomodate English, very polite, fought for your rights while scheduling trips, etc. Can't say enough about how helpful they were. Suspect they may be owners but never able to ask. Definately worked like the Hotel was important to them. Initially refused tips but finally accepted for staff on check out. This was a real treat in an often cold world of travel.

Reviews.Title: “Very simple but homely”
Reviews.Author: willscathlock
Reviews.Content: Great location for exploring Paris within walking distance of Sacre Couer and metro stations. Value for money can be had at this hotel if you browse the web and seek out the best price. Breakfast is nothing special but the little breakfast room that is like a cave is a nice feature.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: daphneknaresborough
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at Les Trois Poussins for 4 nights in August and thoroughly enjoyed our visit. Our bedroom overlooked the courtyard and was spotless - everything including the toiletries were replenished every day. Breakfast was taken downstairs in the cellar dining area - there was plenty to choose from on the buffet - cereal - fruit - croissants - pain au chocolat - petit pain - cheese etc. I would recommend this hotel to anyone - the hotel staff were very helpful. It is in a perfect location with many good restaurants in the vincinity and the Metro station is only a 3 - 4 minute walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable visit”
Reviews.Author: jsk38ke
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I enjoyed our stay at the hotel in mid-July. The staff was very friendly and extremely helpful. The room was nice and very clean. We did have a microwave and stove in our room but no plates/silverware/etc. So, if you plan on using it, plan on bringing your own. The neighborhood was very nice. Plenty of bakeries, restaurants, etc. close by. The metro station was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “A great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: lilywhite26
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel, clean,comfortable, with pleasant staff and a good continental breakfast. The St. Georges metro is only 2 minutes walk away and the area is quiet enough. My only quibble would be that the room we were given was quite small, but then we weren;t in Paris to stay in our room!I would definitely make a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “An outstanding choice for Paris!”
Reviews.Author: sydneygirl1980
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved this hotel. It is quaint, extremely centrally located and reasonably priced. The rooms are not huge but are immacutately kept and all you need. Lots of restaurants to choose from and the metro is just a short walk away. Very highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “A great wee Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Wendi9
Reviews.Content: My partner and I booked this room on the internet after reading other reviews on tripadvisor and as usual this was bang on, people have said it was clean and tidy, which it was, this was a great wee hotel with a real french feel to it, we had a great room overlooking the street, and I would reccomend this room to all, it was room number 203, which had a wee kitchenette in it, not that it had much to cook with, which we never do anyway, as people have said there are 3-4 restaurants at the end of the street, all good ones, the room was in lovely colours, with beautiful draperies etc, the bathroom, though not large was clean and immaculate condition, the bedroom was very large and spacious for France which was a pleasant surprise, the staff spoke very good english and very helpful, all in all a great stay, and would highly reccomend to all.Will stay there again. Thanks for a lovel holiday. Wendi Green Christchurch New Zealand.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Paris on a budget”
Reviews.Author: AmericaTour1998
Reviews.Content: Booked through expedia on basis of reviews both on the expedia website and through trip advisor, me and my girlfriend weren't disappointed. Throughout our stay there were numerous staff on reception, all of which were at least bi-lingual (French + English) and on checking in we were given a complimentry map with the hotel and nearest metro both highlighted, The room was on the small side in comparison to English hotels but was more than adequate and very clean, with a large bathroom that contained a bath (only big enough to stand/sit in for a shower), sink and toilet. Each day the room was cleaned to a good standard and towels were replaced. The nearest metro is liteally 200 meters away and the hotel is in a perfect location to explore the whole of Paris as well as taking advantage of numerous restaurants, bistro's, cafe's and bakery's for breakfast. The hotel were kind enough to store our bags securely for 5 hours after our check out until our train later that day something im sure u wouldnt get from all hotel chains. In summary, a lovely little private hotel with a friendly helpful smiling face on reception a perfect base for exploring Paris and would happily recommend to friends and family. Yes there are more luxurious hotels in Paris but on a budget you cant go wrong!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: BV64
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to Paris and this hotel played a part in making our trip very enjoyable. After long days of walking and touring, it was wonderful to return to a very clean room and comfy beds and pillows. The bathroom was a good size and the air conditioning was a treat. We had a great view from the 6th floor and found the hotel very quiet at night. Just a few minutes walk to the Metro for easy access to all parts of Paris. We walked to local restaurants for breakfast and dinner, and even a 15-minute walk to Montmartre and the Moulin Rouge. The area was safe and very clean (except near the Moulin Rouge it was a bit seedy but once we got off that street it was fine). We highly recommend the following restaurant just around the corner from the hotel: Le Bistrot Lorette (43 rue Notre Dame de Lorette). A prix fixe menu was very reasonable for the absolute gourmet dinner we enjoyed. 25 euros for 2 courses or 30 euros for 3 courses. It was worth every euro and the owner offered wonderful service. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “We Want to Go Back!”
Reviews.Author: MadAnthony
Reviews.Content: Charming hotel in a wonderful neighborhood (filled with more local Parisiens than tourists). Comfortable bed, very clean, helpful staff, good-sized rooms for a European hotel, convenient to metro. Would not hesitate to recommend and will be the first place we look for a vacancy when we return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic little hotel . Loved it”
Reviews.Author: TinaF
Reviews.Content: Just returned on 31 May. We booked this hotel as part of a package with Eurostar and after checking on tripadvisor I was looking forward to our stay as the reviews were good. What a great little hotel. We were staying for 3 nights with our little girl (8) and our room was fantastic (room 003) just off the court yard outside, so at night we got a bottle of wine and sat out in the court yard with the door open to the bedroom and it was fantastic. The only thing was I thought we would have a kitchenette as most of the reviews had mentioned one but our room did not have one. But this was not a problem as I had packed my travel kettle and the hotel provided me with milk every morning so I could make a cup of tea. And we would buy pastries and sit in the court yard and eat them. We never ate breakfast at the hotel as it was 10 euros each and you get far more for your money just around the corner. The hotel was in a great location near to the metro which made getting around paris fantastic. We walked to alot of things. I would like to give a special mention to the No Stress Cafe. We ate there everynight. Not because we are borring but because the food was great, the location to the hotel was great and they were fantastic with out little girl catering for everything she wanted. They do serve food in the day as I noticed one review said it didnt. We had lunch there on our last day as were were leaving around 3PM. The prices were resonable and it ment we could sit out till late and not worry about travelling back to the hotel in th dark as it is 1 mins walk away. Couple of tips visit the museums on the late night openings as the crowds are less and it is cheaper. The Louve is Wednesday and Friday and the Muse des Orsey is Thursday. If you want to go to Versillies buy a combined train and palace ticket from the RER stations (line C) it again is cheaper and you wont have to que when you get there. Absolutly loved our stay and will be returning hopefully very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff / OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chriswick614
Reviews.Content: I visited Paris with my mother and booked two rooms at the Les Trois Poussins in the Montmartre District. Overall the staff at the hotel was excellent. They were always available and willing to help in any way possible. The housekeeping service was equally excellent and the rooms were spotless every afternoon. The hotel itself is small and in a residential neighborhood of Paris. There are plenty of Metro stops nearby so getting anywhere in Paris is not a problem. There are many cafes, bars, and shops in walking distance to the hotel and we particularly liked the "No Stress Cafe" about a half block away. Keep in mind that they only start serving food at 7:30 p.m. so before that it is only drinks and coffee. The rooms, by any standard, are absolutely tiny. The bathrooms barely have enough room for a grown man to fit and the stand-up shower allows virtually no movement once you are inside. Water pressure is good and everything was in good working order. The beds are very comfortable but if you keep your window open, you will get a tremendous amount of street noise, particularly in the waking hours of the morning. The elevator/lift was broken for about half of our stay so we were required to climb several flights of stairs to come up and down from the rooms. This didn't bother me but was a chore for my mother. We ate the breakfast downstairs one time and it was ok...primarily cereal and croissants. The WIFI internet was included in my rate but will not work anywhere other than the lobby or courtyard. The reception in the rooms is almost non-existent. If you purchase the internet access, keep this in mind. There really is some "charm" to this hotel and we did like it for its Paris "feel" and quaint location. Once you get over the initial shock of just how small the rooms are it actually starts to grow on you in a positive way. It is somewhat of a cliche but it is very true: One does not go to Paris to stay all day in a hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “All round Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Daniellejb
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in this beautiful small hotel at the end of January this year. A romantic 4 day trip. On arrival we could see outer scaffholding on the front of the hotel, but this did not hinder anything as in the long run we had a room upgradebecause of it. The location was fantastic. A wonderful array of boutiques and fashionable bars and restaurants surrounding within easy walking distance. A lovely bustling and hip area close by (monmarte, next to the moulin rouge). It was a 2 minute walk to the St Georges metro station and a leisurely stroll to the beautiful Sacre Cour up the hill. Nothing negative to report!! the room was clean, warm, and comfortable. The bathroom also clean and perfect (Room 602). the staff lovely and friendly, perfect english spoken also. I would definately reccommend this hotel to anyone!! (22 and 24 yr old) so especially reccommend to young couples

Reviews.Title: “Paris life and attractions on the doorstep”
Reviews.Author: Chris-Leeds8-UK
Reviews.Content: Stayed withy my family for 4 nights - room 603 can take a double and two small singles so great for a family. I shouldn't tell you this also but it has a small balcony with table/chairs where you can have your breakfast (pop out to one of the nearby bakeries and queue up with the locals) or a bottle of wine in the eve and look over the rooftops of paris - fantastic! We didn't take breakfast as there are so many cafes on the surrounding streets - we ate at a different cafe and restaurant each day and were never disappointed. Places were always full of locals so we felt like we were in the true Paris. Handy tips Champion supermarket - just east of Pigalle metro station. A great creperie (Le Ble Noir) run by a Breton - left out of hotel then right and it is up on the next corner. Good buzzy trattoria - right out of hotel and right again and its on the right. Would definitely go back. Chris from Leeds, UK

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special - you get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: sambo08
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four night stay in this hotel. Having booked it based on trip advisor reviews (as I usually do ), I was a bit disappointed. Yes the location is great - a couple of minutes walk to the metro, Sacre Coeur, Moulin Rouge and the convienient bakeries and cafes of Rue des Martyrs. However, the rooms were incredibly noisy early in the mornings and in the evenings. This was not due to particularly noisy guests, but more to do with the paper thin walls and rattling window panes - we could hear our fellow guests conversations, hair dryers, doors opening (and slamming), TVs, etc etc. Also the beds are incredibly small and overall the place could do with a lick of paint! This is no gem of a hotel in my opinion- plenty of similar places in Paris, but if you are an early riser and a heavy sleeper and are looking for basic, clean, reasonably priced accommodation close to the metro then Les Trois Poussins will do the job!

Reviews.Title: “Good location...Small Beds”
Reviews.Author: copperbottom
Reviews.Content: Great location...much more real paris than the grandeur of the usual hotels. Inbetween the main tourist attractions and main street near by is very nice. Hotel is small and cosy. Rooms are very clean and tidy and quiet. Baths are tiny and the double beds are also very small. Friendly staff and easy going. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Preconceptions Destroyed”
Reviews.Author: badbab00n
Reviews.Content: When we finally got there, car / plane / CDGVAL / train / 20 minute walk (from Gare du Nord - doh!!!) it was still early evening and my partner and I were both impressed. From the outset the staff were very friendly and the room was more than adequate for our needs. We were there for 5 days and the only thing we missed were tea and coffee making facilities. The various people on reception (I think I counted 4 in 5 days) were all helpful and were able to answer the vast majority of our questions and the taxi we booked for our return to CDG arrived on time at the cost they advised (40 - 45 Euro). Breakfast was avaialble in the lounge between 7 and 10 each morning for 10 Euro per person and was a simple affair of a cold buffet so we went round the corner where we could get a bit more for the cash. The bed was comfy and was made each day when the whole room was tidied very well with new towels regardless of how late we made it out. Our room (107) looked out onto the streets and the double glazing was ample to drown out any noise from outside, unfortunately the interior walls / ceiling were not capable of hiding the other guests' movements / toilet flushes / air conditioning drone / etc... The bathroom is great, well lit, big mirror, spacious shower, wall mounted hair drier, shaver point and nice towels. There's then ample dressing table space back in the bedroom which also houses a flat screen TV. For unpacking for a week or so there's plenty of drawers and hanging space (could do with a couple more hangars) and also in the wardrobe there's a good enough safe. There is a small kitchenette which I wasn't expecting with fridge and electric hob - we never used it but it was there. All in all though we were very pleased with the location (we walked easily to all sights, Arc de Triomphe / Notre Dame / Sacre Couer / Eiffel Tower / Louvre / etc...), the staff were great and the room was more than enough for what we needed and all at a reasonable price. Basically, for the mid budget traveller to Paris, we would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hunteg
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at Les Trois Poussins Hotel. We found it did the job and provided a good venue from which to explore Paris. Some reviews on here, seem to rave on and on....i'm not going to do that...people shouldnt be so surprised that they get what they pay for !!! Les Trois Poussins adequately meets expectations. Rooms are cleaned daily and the breakfast provided was adequate and plentiful. Only slight downside was that our room was on the bottom floor, so no view - that and there were no coffee making facilities in the room. Some good restaurants around - "no stress cafe" is excellent. Keep away from the little restaurant that you get to by turning right out of three poussins and then left at the bottom of the street - wish I could remember the name !!! Staff at poussins are friendly, helpful and courteous. It's an Easy metro ride to central Paris. Rue Clauzel, is easily accessible from Gare du Nord, if travelling by train. - which I strongly recommend. Keep away from taxi drivers. Honestly, you dont need them in Paris - get the RER out of de Gaulle and use the metro !! George Hunter.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: kenegelly
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night only (19 November), and booked on the basis of previous reviews. Wasn't disappointed. Hotel was spotless, staff were extremely helpful and friendly, and our room (superior type) was extremely spacious by Paris standards. Hotel is in a very quiet area, within easy walking distance of a metro station. Although there was strike action on most modes of transport, we still found it quite easy to walk to all the major attractions from here. Would definately stay here next time!

Reviews.Title: “The good reviews are true!”
Reviews.Author: swimmrbabe
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel because of all the wonderful reviews that I had read on this website. Once I booked the hotel, there were one or two people did not give the hotel a favorable review, I started to worry. We arrived in Paris at 11am and walked to the hotel (not a bad walk from Gare Nord). We stopped by the hotel to see if we could leave our bags with them until we could check in so we would be able to explore. Much to our excitement, they prepared our room for us then and allowed us to check in about 3 hours early!! The staff was quite hospitable -- they gave great directions. The Metro stop, St. Georges is quite close and you can easily access all the major sites from it. We didn't have any problems with the room, it was a good size (quite big for Europe), the bathroom was clean (the tiles were a little cracked but that didn't bother me at all). The maid cleaned our room and gave us new towels (I think I read somewhere here that they did not recieve the same treatment). Although we didn't watch tv, there was a nice flat panel one in the room. Note: If the dor is locked, you have to ring the bell, just be aware. And they do take your key when you leave the building, but I liked this because it was one less thing I had to carry while I was walking around. I would stay at this hotel and would tell others to do the same.

Reviews.Title: “Not disappointed in the least!”
Reviews.Author: sbduo
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a brief visit to Paris, having reviewed this hotel on tripadvisor and decided on it based on the positive comments. We were not disappointed in the least. The staff was very friendly and helplful to us. They noticed us walk in with a bottle of wine, and quickly produced glasses for our use. Our room was small but tastefully decorated, bed was comfortable and the bathroom was spotless (but small). The local restaurants were great. Having arrived at the Gare du Nord, we easily found our way to the hotel (using a Google map I had printed). The walk took about 10 to 15 minutes. We do plan to return to Paris and will stay again at Les Trois Poussins.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Tik_Tak01
Reviews.Content: Thought this hotel was great. It was clean and comfortable, tastefully decorated, the staff were friendly and helpful, the rooms were a good size and it had a little courtyard garden. The hotel is in a fantastic location for the eurostar and the rest of Paris generally. There are a number of quality bars and restaurants in the immediate area and it is not too touristy. About 5 minutes walk away is the red light district with the Moulin Rouge and some lively bars and whatever else a red light district provides! If that is not to your taste, the red light area does not overspill into the area the hotel is in, which is fairly quiet and feels very safe. There is also the Sacre Coeur church a short walk away with amazing views over Paris. The hotel location is also very handy for the Metro and is about 15- 20 minutes from the main tourist attractions of Paris. I would definity return to this hotel and it is excellent for the price range.

Reviews.Title: “Same hotel ?”
Reviews.Author: Polarbear8661
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at Les trois Pouissants after having read all the positive rewievs on this website, but i can't help wondering if i have stayed at at different hotel, because i wasn't impressed. I agree that the location was good - close to the Metro, and with several restaurants nearby. The room was small, but clean. On the pluss side - there was a fridge. There were no chairs in our room - and the bed.....well maybe the root of all my reservations lies here, because the bed was terrible !! We stayed there for 4 nights - and i didn't have one good night sleep. The last night i spent half the night on the floor - it was softer than the bed. The room, the corridors and stairway seemed rundown. The lift really was tiny. Two persons and a suitcase and the lift was full. Breakfast was ok, but not more. It costs 10 euro - and you can get a better deal if you choose to eat at a cafe. There was a great, little foodstore on the way from the metro to the hotel - we stopped there twice a day, bought some fruit and something to drink. The owner always took his time to talk to us, he told us what the weather was going to be like - and he gave us tips on where to eat etc. The hotel is ok - but judging from our room it is more of a 2 star hotel than a 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “a metro ride from all the great sights in Paris”
Reviews.Author: amunastra
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to the metro station the bars and resturants can be expensive but the 3 poussins hotel in Paris have fridges in their room and if you want to save money turn right outside the Hotel then left at the end of the street and up on the right after a 5 minute walk is the Champion supermarket where everything is very cheap.The people are very friendly and the sights were amazing

Reviews.Title: “Small hide away in busy Paris”
Reviews.Author: Spymon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a surprise birthday weekend. I have visited Paris a number of times before but this was my first time staying there in a hotel. We arrived early at the hotel, which was easy to find and close to a nearby metro station which is very convenient when you are travelling to Paris by Eurostar. The lobby/front desk area was clean and modern and staff spoke both English and French which was handy. As we were early we couldn’t yet check in but our bags were taken and we were told we could come back early afternoon as our room would be ready then. This gave us a few moments to rest and to get some lunch. Our room was ready shortly after we returned to the hotel after lunch. We were on the first floor facing the street. I guess there were two negatives to this stay which we noticed fairly quickly. One was the lift; it was noisy, small and jumpy. Secondly was the noise, on our first night there was quite a bit of street noise, also in the morning the lift was noise as the hotel was being cleaned. I’d imagine this was less of a problem with a rear facing and/or higher room. However, the second night there was hardly any noise so perhaps the first night we were just unlucky. Although small the room was comfortable and on the whole well laid out. The bathroom was spotlessly clean but a little cramped for two though shower gel, shampoo and the like were provided. We did not use the hotel for breakfast but we did order some coffees which were ready when promised (though I did lose a little coffee when the lift lurched to a halt). However as this was a fun trip this was something to laugh about and not to get angry with. The location is fine and pretty much everywhere we wanted to visit was only a metro ride away. We did not eat locally but there appeared to be a good choice of restaurants for all times of the day within five minutes walk from the hotel. In all this hotel seemed good value and would come recommended, clean, polite service, just make sure to have a room as far from the lift as possible if you can!

Reviews.Title: “Just the job”
Reviews.Author: Norbiton
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for somewhere reasonably priced, wonderfully quiet, comfortable and discreetly stylish in a fascinating untouristy part of Paris but within easy reach of the centre, where the staff are friendly and helpful and great places to eat and drink are literally a stone's throw away, then you're unlikely to be disappointed by the Trois Poussins. Our room wasn't huge but cleverly designed so it didn't feel at all cramped, and the dark wood furniture as well as the flat screen TV made it seem quite luxurious. The shower room was modern and sparkling clean. The surrounding area offers the delights of Montmartre and Sacre Coeur with its spectacular views over the city (though it's a steep climb) and the rather old-fashioned and very unthreatening sleaze of Pigalle. We sampled the 9eme restaurant and aptly named No Stress cafe, both a few steps from the hotel and both offering excellent food and wine. Breakfast in the hotel is also fine with cereals, pastries, rolls, cheese, fruit, juice and unlimited coffee. On Sunday morning the shops in the Rue des Martyrs round the corner are all open offering delectable cakes and pastries as well as cheeses, fish, wine, chocolate and second-hand books. The St Georges Metro station is only three minutes walk away and within easy reach from the Gare du Nord if you're arriving by Eurostar. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during May 2007 and found it very enjoyable. The rooms are small but bright and very clean. It seemed to be a very safe location with cafes, bakeries and small grocery stores nearby. It is located very close to St. Georges Metro - so only a few quick train changes to some of the highlights of Paris. It is also only a $10 Euro cab ride to Eurostar. The front desk was very helpful in providing directions and advice. Bottled water was also available for only $2.00 Euro. A breakfast was available also for $10 Euro per day, but it is very very basic. I would recommend this hotel - it was a very romantic getaway for my husband and I.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for a weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: Dims57
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel, well located in a quiet yet central area. 2 mins walk from St Georges metro (20/30 min walk to Louvre). Plenty of small shops and cafes right around the corner from the hotel. Even though it's sort of near Pigalle (10 min walk) we didn't see or come across any trouble at all. Fairly spacious room considering its in Paris. Very clean and comfortable. No extras but you get what you pay for. The staff were friendly but didn't go out of their way to help us. There was also a fridge in the room, although there were no tea/coffee making facilities, a small thing I know but I missed that and just assumed you got that everywhere. Would definitely recommend for a clean, reasonable and comfortable stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlwaysawayDouglas
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights in early March 07. Hotel rooms were quite large, for Paris, very clean with a nice cold buffet breakfast served in the cellar restaurant. Staff were very helpful and the hotel is positioned between the Sacre Coeure and the Galleries Lafayette area's, both are within reasonable walking distance. Alternatively there is a metro just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “would definitely come back”
Reviews.Author: hodgebabe
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from 3 nights inthis lovely little hotel. It is situated within easy walking distance of Sacre Coeur. The rest of tourist Paris was easily reached by metro a few hundred yards away. The staff were helpful and spoke good english. A whole variety of restaurants were within easy walking distance as was a high street of shops selling local produce. It felt very safe. One minus is that the breakfast room is quite small with tables vey close together if you could get one. I would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “lovely spot, great service”
Reviews.Author: cloudboyNewZealand
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel, good value for money. Rooms are tidy and clean. The staff were very pleasant and helpful and speak good English. The location is just one minute's walk to a small cluster of 5 or 6 restaurants. Although the location is not immediately close to sights of interest, the hotel is just 3 mins walk to the subway. Also being slightly off the main drag makes the area fairly quiet so it makes for quiet and peaceful sleeping. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KiKi88
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from 30/04/07 for 3 nights. For a 3 star hotel it was absolutely wonderful On arrival the receptionist was very welcoming and helpful, she even provided us with a map of the city and directed us the nearest Metro station (Staint Georges, which is only 3 mins walk). Our room was on the 4th floor (dont worry there is a lift facility), looking into the back of the hotel. The size was the room was surprisingly spacious, particularly for Paris. Well decorated and very clean. We had AC, flat screen TV, a safe, telephone and room service. Attached to the room is a separate en suite, again a good size. The room was cleaned and towels (and soap) changed every day. We did have breakfast included with our stay: it was very basic. Nothing to rave about but nothing to complain about bearing the mind the price we paid and the fact that its a 3 star hotel. On our last day we had to check out by noon, which is fine. The hotel also had facilitiles for us to keep our luggage on site until we had to leave, which was at 5pm. Hotel staff were all very friendly and helpful. Would definatey stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Comfortable Nest”
Reviews.Author: MrsBear87
Reviews.Content: A charming hotel. It is not for for those desiring sumptious accomodations. Rooms are small by US standards, but I didn't go to Paris to spend time in my hotel! The staff is courteous, helpful and friendly. English was spoken by all. The rooms were very clean, and as indicated in other reviews, the hotel is well situated in a neighborhood that is safe and convenient to the Metro. Ask about what extras the different rooms offer. We booked two singles, and my room had a small fridge, two burner cooktop and wash-up sink. Very nice should you walk to the nearby merchants and buy some things for snacking. My companions room faced the inner courtyard, mine the main street. All in all, a very nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Trip Advisors were correct”
Reviews.Author: Littlewood
Reviews.Content: Yes everything I had read on T.A. was correct. The hotel is conveniently situated in a quiet street only 5 mins from St Georges Metro. Lots of shops, delicatessens, restaurants, bars nearby Hotel was very clean. Rooms well appointed. All the staff were very friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. Breakfast was included in our rate and was OK. Dined at the Le Charlaine - excellent cuisine with friendly staff. No Stress Cafe is very good too, although I did not dine there, I had few drinks - staff again really friendly. My Tip is, if visiting at busy times, visit Eiffel Tower and Louvre in evenings. I visited at Easter and there were really large queues during the day.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat disappointing”
Reviews.Author: JuneBride
Reviews.Content: I had read the positive reviews before making my decision to stay there with my husband. We're in our 30s. We stayed there for 3 nts in Oct 2006. We were put in a room with two sets of doors (I'm assuming for sound insulation) next to the front lobby and I do not recommend staying in that room. Loud people came by in the middle of the nt and woke me up. The room was somewhat worn, but the bathroom was brand new. I don't know what other rooms are like in the hotel. The front desk staff was nice and speak English. I spk French, but my husband doesn't. I wouldn't stay there again because it's not in an interesting location. I would stay in Montmartre itself or the left bank area again or the 4th arrond/Marais. We stayed in the Latin Quarter for one night. That was a fun area! My friends are going for 4 nts and they are splitting them up by staying 2 nights in the L.Q. or St Germain and 2 in Montmartre and I think that's perfect to experience different parts of the city.

Reviews.Title: “What a superb little hotel”
Reviews.Author: bramblePlymouth
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our first trip to Paris and stayed at this lovely small hotel set in a very quiet street. We were ideally situated for all the main attractions with the Metro of St Georges just around the corner and the number 67 bus at the end of the road. The hotel itself is small but extremely clean. The staff couldn't be more helpful and the buffet style breakfast at 10 euros was excellent value. If we go to Paris again we will definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great 3-star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rbshaw2000
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay at Trois Poussins Hotel. Hotel is on a quiet street near many restaurants and one block from the Metro station. Staff was very helpful and the rooms immaculate. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: theD&Jcollective
Reviews.Content: The area around the hotel is lovely - lots of interesting little shops. The location is also good - it's an easy walk up to Montmartre and down to the Seine. Our room was clean and quiet; breakfast was tasty; staff were friendly. All in all, a perfect base for visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Chic!”
Reviews.Author: RayandDenise
Reviews.Content: Tres Bien! Our French may not be too good but we know what we like! Our first accomodation experience in Europe and we weren't disappointed. The hotel is in a great position, only 10 minutes walk from Montemarte/Moulin Rouge (what a buzzz at night) and the beautiful Sacre Couer. The local train station, St George, is only 3 minutes walk, and the Gard Du Nord is walkable also. Restaurants and cafes abound, all with a safe neighbourhood flavour, not touristy or overpriced. We love walking, and the walk to Notre Dame took 2hours through some great neighbourhoods. The Louvre is closer! The La Fayette historic shopping centre is just down the road, as is the Opera House. The hotel is cute, wonderful chic foyer, and the room was (we understand) typically small, but chic again, and the bathroom modern and sparkling. The staff are friendly and informative. The breakfast was adequate and tasty in a vaulted "Basement" room. The little courtyard is a lovely green space to relax in. When we come back to Paris, we will stay here - what greater recommendation could we give.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Bzibzia
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff couldn’t be nicer, they were extremely helpful and kind. They even took time to teach us helpful French phrases. The entire place was immaculate, our room was cleaned thoroughly every day. The hotel is conveniently located near Saint-Georges metro station, so it is easy to get around Paris without having to endure the traffic or noise. The street is very quiet, with numerous neighborhood stores located nearby. I would definitely stay there again, particularly considering the reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Really convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Kandy90
Reviews.Content: Really convenient location - you can walk there from the Gare du Nord. Although near Metro, we also discovered the 67 bus, which passes the end of the road and meanders through Paris, taking you to the Louvre and the Ile de la Cite, then returns to Pigalle.There's been some debate about breakfast at the hotel, but at 10 Euros, for unlimited coffee, juice etc, we thought it was quite good value. The restaurant a couple of doors down from the hotel is absolutely excellent - and if you like mussels, Leon at Place Pigalle is the best this side of Brussels! Only downside was a light that kept coming on outside our room, bit like being in a lighthouse at times.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, convenient and reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: DesignerDave
Reviews.Content: Picked Les Trois Poussins after searching the web for recommendations for a decent and reasonable hotel in Paris. We were very happy with the choice; the room we got was on the third floor and was very quiet (with the window closed). The room was small, but clean and comfortable and the bathrom was fine, although my wife would have prefered to have a bath (remember to indicate this in advance as the hotel only has 6, or so rooms with baths. The room also had a fridge and a hot plate in case one wanted to do some basic food preparation (we didn't use this, but I think one probably has to pay something to do so). The guy in reception at night is not very friendly, but the day staff are very polite and helpful. The location is very convenient being 2 minutes from the metro station "St Georges" and only about 10-15 minutes from the Sacre Coeur. This also means that it is close to Pigale and the some of the dodgy stuff that goes on around there, but it's not an issue unless you specifically go to the wrong areas (there is certainly no problem around the area of the hotel itself). As recommended by some others, there is a great restaurant just 40m, or so up the road from the hotel (Charlain) which is absolutely worth a visit. Others have also recommended the "No Stress Cafe" (also just around the corner) and the staff there were extremely friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: RKPT
Reviews.Content: Just returned from staying at this superb hotel. The area was good and the metro just around the corner. What a treasure of little shops and cafes nearby. Our room although a wee bit tired, was spacious and had a little kitchen. Beds were spotless and we had no problem with noise at night. When I return to Paris I will definitely stay at this hotel again. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: N1973
Reviews.Content: I have no reservations about recommending this hotel whatsoever. The rooms were clean, the staff polite (and spoke very good english) and the location convenient. I cannot comment upon the food as I did not eat there. I suppose it is a little walk from the nearest metro stations, but nothing too epic and one will certainly not get bored en route - there are a few strip clubs and sex shops in the Pigalle area and, indeed, the Moulin Rouge itself is nearby! But this is to brand the locale with a rather seedy image; we went to have a look at the Moulin Rouge at about 2am (we had just returned from Disneyland) and felt quite safe. A very nice hotel in a very interesting neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “ideal for family of three/four”
Reviews.Author: Citytraveller2
Reviews.Content: I took my two teenage daughters here at October half-term. We were looking for a hotel that was clean, reasonably priced and close to the metro. We also needed to have three seperate beds! I emailed the hotel in advance and they arranged to have the single bed-settee made up as well as the double and single bed. As last in the room, I had to sleep on that bed-settee and it was comfortable enough. We had room 601 - on the top floor in the rafters. A view of Sacre Coeur from one window (see photos). There was a kitchenette with fridge & small cooker, but I think it was 3 euros a day for utensils - take camping kit if you want to use them! I also needed to take my own kettle - we English love our tea. We booked through the english website hotelsrus and got a better deal than booking direct with th hotel - and breakfast was free! I wont repeat all the other reviewers comments, but it was very clean (apart from some mould on the showerhead). It was also very quiet. I agree the breakfast cost of 10 euros is very high and would have eaten out if it wasn't free. The taxi ride from Gare Du Nord (Eurostar) was about 8 euros but we couldn't get a taxi back on Friday evening as they were all booked up, so we used the metro. Altogether a good deal in an expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless weekend!!”
Reviews.Author: Andy501
Reviews.Content: I cannot fault our stay at this hotel. It was clean, and the rooms were extremely well appointed, (my boyfriend and I shared a good sized double, which even had a fridge in the room - handy for chilling wine...) It is situated on a quiet street, and there is very efficient double glazing.....We didn't even realise it was morning until we opened the windows! The location is good for the Metro, and the Montmartre district is only a short walk away. We also ate out locally, and there appear to be a good selection of restaurants close to the hotel. The breakfast selection was superb, and the reception staff were friendly and helpful - although I do speak French, they likewise seem fairly fluent in English.... We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: Miisty
Reviews.Content: After trawling through the hundreds of hotels available in Paris and using the Tripadvisor site for reviews this hotel faired the best overall and the reviews were right. Staff were friendly and the room was very clean, modern, and plenty big enough as a base to stay. We stayed for 3 days but we would have been comfortable for longer. The hotel is on a very quiet street considering it's a city and it's far enough away from the red light district for it to be irrelevant. It's actually in a very nice area with the rue due Martyrs having some really lovely shops and patisseries, St George metro station very close and 10 mins to Opera area in eve. The Charlain restaurant (about 3 doors to the left out of the hotel) is absolutely fabulous and I can't believe there aren't more comments on here about it. Excellent food and very friendly owners! No stress cafe didn't seem to be opening early enough for breakfast but guess it is November after all. Did have a late afternoon drink there and it is very relaxed. The Montmarte area and Sacre Cour is within walking distance and is an excellent place to see views of the whole of the city at night. This is a really good time of the year to go as there were little or no queues for any of the major attractions such as Louvre or Eiffel Tower, stay to see the Louvre pyramid at night as it looks amazing. Very enjoyable stay and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for tourists”
Reviews.Author: Peugeot_driver
Reviews.Content: Good english speaking staff (neither my wife nor I speak French). Plenty of facilites near by ie Cafes, railway station, laundry, shops etc. Short ride by taxi to railway station for chunnel train to England. Enjoyed our stay and would return again to this hotel. This was our first time in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Cute little Parisian hotel”
Reviews.Author: GPAC
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from spending three nights in Paris at Les Trois Poussins Hotel with family including my two year-old daughter. The hotel was small, but cute. We stayed in a deluxe room on the 6th floor with a nice little terrace and a view of the Eiffel Tower (at night with the lights twinkling, was quite a sight!) The hotel staff, especially Laurance, whom I emailed frequently prior to my stay, was very welcoming and pleasant. She was very helpful especially since she did her best at having at least one of our two rooms ready for us at arrival since we arrived (like most flights from the U.S.) in the early morning. We did not have breakfast at the hotel, instead choosing to walk down to a restaurant called Le Remauderie (I think that's the correct spelling) for great omelettes, crunchy baguettes and delicious hot chocolate. One thing, as other reviewers have noted, this hotel is very close to the Pigalle district (red light district). Our first afternoon there, wanting to walk to Montmartre (possible, but quite a walk), we strolled into the Pigalle area and passed right in front of a couple of establishments with "ladies" in lingerie staring out the windows, waiting for patrons. Luckily, my daughter is too young to realize what was going on, let alone ask any questions, but if you're traveling with older kids or teens you might want to be aware.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Jiffo
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for 7 days through Eurostar and got it a lot cheaper than advertised. Its in a good part of town to escape the tourist hoards and is well located 200m from St George Metro and a 15 min walk from Gard du Nord. The room we had (107) was quiet and spacious with a fridge in it! The room was cleaned to perfection each day whilst we were out and about; and the staff at reception were all helpful and polite. The bed was firm and level and the bathroom larger than in most hotels of this grade. If you are looking to be pampered by room service and taxi bookings, etc, this is NOT the place to go. But if you are fairly independant and looking for value and cleanliness, you cannot go wrong. Don't bother with the breakfast - go to any cafe in the area and have the same for 5-6 Euros. The restaraunt "The Stress Free Cafe" at the end of the road does good food and wine with friendly service. We had a great holiday enhanced by the fact that the hotel did not intrude upon it!!! Be aware that if you book through an agent you are still liable for a 1 Euro per person per day "city tax" direct to the hotel on departure. I'm not sure if this is a scam or not, but was insignificant enough not to worry about.

Reviews.Title: “Great Parisian location”
Reviews.Author: Jezzabell
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Trois Poussins for four nights whilst visiting Paris for my birthday. We booked it via the Eurostar website and were not disappointed. It was a 15-20 minute walk from Gare du Nord which was welcomed after a 2.5 hour train journey. The staff were friendly and spoke excellent english. The room was comfortable and had 2 big windows, although the bath was a little small, but i know this is pretty standard in french hotels. Rue Clauzel is just off Rue des Martyrs, which was so un-touristy and full of lovely french food shops, and plenty of cafes for breakfast as we did not bother with it at the hotel, just wanted to get out in Paris as early as possible. The Sacre Coeur is visible up the hill from Rue des Martyrs and did not take us that long to walk to on our first night and the views were stunning. The only bad thing was being woken around 8.30am on the sunday morning by the cleaners, rather unwelcome as the saturday night had been Nuit Blanche ('Sleepless night'), when Paris stays awake all night, and we didn't get to bed until around 4am! However, I would definately recommend Les Trois Poussins to anyone wanting to experience an area a bit more Parisian than others and we found easy walking (well stared using the metro on the 3rd day) distance to everywhere. One final tip from my point of view, don't bother queuing for the Eiffel Tower, walk up the steps to the top of the Arc de Triomph, it only cost 8 euros, there were no queues and you had amazing views from the absolute centre of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic food”
Reviews.Author: MaryWood
Reviews.Content: Myy husband, daughter and her partner visited in early September. I had read other reviews and knew roughly what to expect. We were not disappointed. As I have a walking problem, we had a downstairs room and the dining area down a spiral staircase was not hard to manage. the breakfasts were tea, coffee, cereal, selection of croissants etc, and bowls of grapefruit or mixed pineapple, mango and ? pear. We slept well every night (it was very quiet) except when residents took off noisily at 2-3 am one morning (but that was soon over!). We visited local cafes: No Stress Cafe (turn L outside the front door). This was well-frequented by locals - we had plates of (different) tapas. We also visited 9'eme (opposite No Stress Cafe) and Restaurant Lepic in rue Lepic (up the road from the Moulin Rouge). We recommend the Batobus for sightseeing from the river (11 euros all-day) but not the open-top bus unless you have a 2-day ticket for 28 euros (1 day is 25 euros. Beware many local shops don't open on Mondays (we tried to do this on our last day - a Monday). Montmatre and Sacre Coeur are 'musts' and easy to walk to (uphill) if you are good at walking. We also recommend the all-day shop around the corner (turn right and right). Very pleasant owner who sells groceries, bottled water etc and excellent fresh fruit and he never seems to close! We had a wonderful 'short break' and the hotel staff could not have been nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Good City Break Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Phil_Owen
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel for those looking for a busy break seeing the sights of Paris. Very close to the St. George Metro Station in a quiet enclave of resturants and bars and parisian housing. Choice of places to eat both at the start and end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint hotel - loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: Scottishsmiths
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with our 8 y.o. son for 3 nights - loved the area and perfect if you are looking for a glimpse of a more residential setting in Paris. The surrounding streets are full of reasonably priced restaurants - we particularly liked the Lebanese in rue des Martens (turn right out of the hotel, and right again) and one street is very interesting if you want to soak up watching the Parisians buying their groceries - this is also handy if you want to buy some food yourself and take it back to your room. We had a small kitchen so this came in handy and we were able to have snacks and cold drinks when we returned after long, tiring days competing with other tourists to see the wonderful sights of Paris - and being ripped off for food and drinks throughout our daytime activities! The hotel is very close to the Pigalle red light district and there were certain streets that were full of parlours - we found these entertaining to walk past in the early evening, however, did feel a little uneasy late at night but managed this without incident. Amongst all the other wonderful sights I would recommend walking up to the Sacre Coeur at night to see the wonderful views of the city and to watch the Eiffel Tower light up and become a glittering spectacle for 10 mins on the hour. Of course you need to go up quite late in the summer as it doesn't get dark until 10-11 p.m. Gorgeous though and well worth the effort. Only problem in the hotel was that the standard double room with extra bed for our son was rather squashed (there were no triples or superior doubles available) and we had to carefully pack away our huge amount of luggage so we could walk around the beds. Had a good view onto the street however and found the hotel so pleasant that the space issue became irrelevant. The numerous male reception staff were all extremely helpful, only problem was the one female staff member who was unable to comprehend how to assist me to obtain my airline's phone number. Not actually rude as such, just seemed really unintelligent! Another male receptionist, for example, went out of his way to book us the bus out to the airport and this all went very smoothly. Would definitely stay here again if we ever return to this wonderful city and will be recommending this atmospheric hotel to anyone I know who is visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TiggyC2
Reviews.Content: Mid July 2006 4 Nights The hotel is in a pleasant and lively area of Paris and within easy walking distance of both the Gare du Nord and Gare St Lazare. In another direction one can walk to the Place de l'Opera and the Grands Magazins in about 15/20 minutes. The staff are pleasant and helpful, the hotel is clean and the public rooms perfectly adequate. My only less-than-positive comment is that our room was quite small and the bed had a tendancy to slope towards the middle! As the weather was extremely hot, this meant some restless nights, although there is air conditioning. In fairness to the hotel, we didn't ask to be moved to another room. At the time breakfast was not included in the price but there are many cafes or bars close by for a good coffee and croissant or tartine. There are also several reasonably-priced restaurants in the neighbourhood for lunch or dinner. The building itself is attractive and each window overlooking the side street had a window box full of geraniums. All in all, a good value and pleasant Parisian hotel with character.

Reviews.Title: “A great wee hotel”
Reviews.Author: KatMacG
Reviews.Content: My husband, 11yr old daughter and I stayed for four nights in this great wee hotel. We had room 3 which along with room 1 opens out into a tiny court yard where we could sit at night - great when you have kids with you. The hotel was spotless and the staff were very helpful. Just a couple of minutes away from the metro and a few more to the Sacre Coeur it's in a great position. If you try this - also try the bistro on the corner (The No Stress Cafe) - good food and service.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It was my boyfriend and I's first time to Paris, and what a perfect place to stay. The hotel is very parisian and quaint. Clean, pretty, very helpful staff and a great area. It is a lovely old part of the city with a metro stop very close. Great little cafes and shops, a wonderful atmoshere. We fell in love with Paris and plan to go back asap, we wouldn't stay anywhere else as this hotel was just lovely and all we needed at an affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “Best value, it made the holiday!”
Reviews.Author: sg1Cumbria
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic value considering its location. It has clean and comfortable (and air conditioned) rooms and we were delighted that we even got a kitchennette complete with fridge (which was a bonus in the recent hot weather). The room was serviced every day and the staff were very friendly. They let us leave our luggage until 7pm on the day we checked out! There is a small but cute courtyard in the centre of the hotel where you can have a coffee, and the little added extras like newspapers, matches and sweets, and fresh flowers in reception add to the charm of this place. We had a room that faced out onto the street at the back of the hotel which wasn't noisy at all. The hotel doesn't offer spectacular views of the city but a short metro or bus journey will take you into the heart of Paris, and a stroll up to Montmartre will ensure you the best views (from the Sacre Couer). The red light district (Pigalle) is where you'll find the Moulin Rouge and it is nearby but don't let this put you off. There are several blocks in between the hotel and this area and they are full of lovely restaurants and bars (and a whole street devoted to guitar shops!) We will definitely go back to this hotel. To stay in a quality hotel really made our trip special. We can't recommend it highly enough if you like value for money and want a quality stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: volvic10
Reviews.Content: June 2006. We've just returned from a 4 night stay at The Trois Pouissons Hotel in Paris. We found the hotel very sweet and in a great location. We had a double room with a balcony, with a really nice bathroom. At the end of the street was a lovely little square with 2 Indian restaurants, a nice laid back all purpose cafe/restaurant with great Tapas, and another cafe that we did not try. The athmosphere at this square was very pleasant and full of chatter and laugher.It was great after a day of visiting the tourist locations to get back to the area where the hotel is and to chill out.

Reviews.Title: “Think twice before booking this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: April44
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel for 4 days and found it to be central to nothing! It was a fair hike up to the main area of Montmartre and we passed many hotels on the way which would have been far more preferable to us. On the first night we attended the Moulin Rouge (which was absolutely fantastic) and returned to the hotel at about 2am. We took the (very small) lift to our room on the 5th floor and to our dismay, the doors didn't open. We returned to the ground floor, still the doors didn't open. We pressed the alarm button and the night clerk responded immediately. To his credit he did everything he could to raise a technician and kept talking to us to make sure we were OK and apologising profusely. We were stuck in that lift for over an hour! In contrast, next morning the owners/management only comment to us was "Oh you were the ones stuck in the lift, sorry". No real apology, no offer of maybe a free breakfast, nothing. On the morning of the day we were due to leave - a Friday before a long weekend - I requested a taxi be ordered for 5pm to take us to the Gard de Nord. I was assured that there were plenty of taxis in Paris and this would be OK. I expressed my concern that it was a Friday afternoon beforea holiday weekend but was waved away with assurances that it would be fine.Of course it wasn't. We arrived back at the hotel at 4.30pm to find the taxi had not been ordered and as to be expected, it was impossible to find one at that hour. We ended up almost running with all our luggage all the way to the station. We would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice to come home to!”
Reviews.Author: snake47
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Les Trois Poussins for a short break (couple) having spent hours reviewing different hotels on the Trip Adviser site. This one seemed to please most of its guests and had a high rating. Only reservation in our mind was that a friend had warned us not to stay near the Pigalle (red light) district, as there were some decidedly dodgy side streets around there - this seemed a little too close for comfort on the map! We needn't have worried though. Admittedly, Pigalle was very close on foot - and fascinating to walk through on your way to the Montmartre late afternoon (not so sure about after dark) but the area improved considerably as we approached St George's. It is very close to the tube station (5 minutes) and the town where there are numerous shops, bars, restaurants, pharmacies etc. The fact that it is on a quiet side road means you hear none of the noise though, even on the busy Saturday night when the very local bars seemed to really come to life. The main sights are easily accessible by tube and even on foot if you like walking. The hotel is charming, really clean and nicely laid out rooms. Our room looked very similar to that advertised. Spotless sheets and towels, clean every day. Satellite TV (limited channels but handy just the same). We even had a little kitchenette (stove & fridge) joined on to the room which was an unexpected bonus, especially as the weather was very hot when we were there so we could take out cold drinks each day. I don't think all rooms had this however. Staff very helpful. No restaurant or bar but a very small but sweet patio area and reception staff were happy to get us a coffee on arrival. Only criticism and a minor one - Had breakfast one day only and at 11 euros each, this was a bit expensive. Cafes nearby were more reasonable and perfectly adequate for a continental breakfast. Get a taxi from Gard du Nord on arrival/departure if you can afford it. Not too expensive (approx. 8 euros each way) and a bit fiddly by tube (2 changes and lots of steps) when travelling with your luggage. Mind you, we did have to queue for a taxi for about 45 minutes on arrival late on a Thursday evening. Journey to hotel - 10 minutes. A day ticket for the Seine cruise is very good value and a great way to rest your feet between seeing the sights as you can get on and off as you please and never wait more than 20 minutes for the next boat at each stop. On our last day we travelled to the St Ouen Flea Market as detailed in our travel guide. A very socially deprived and grotty area surrounded by miles of stalls selling cheap clothes and tacky souveniers. When we finally found the antiquity part (badly signposted), it was interesting, but the prices were ridiculous - not particularly recommended unless you fancy parting with 2000 euros and bringing home a moth eaten moosehead or 7 euros for a plastic Eiffel Tower. If you are a collector, take a van - its more furniture and large items than knick knacks unless we missed some of it. Booked a 'Da Vinci code' walking tour from the 'London Walks' company in London. It was excellent. English guide was knowledgable, funny and very interesting. Highly recommended. They run other tours if this one is not your cup of tea. Have a great trip and do try Les Trois Poissins.

Reviews.Title: “From Hilton Eiffel to Tres Poussins - Liked the First, Fell in Love with Poussin”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights at the Paris Hilton (Eiffel Tower) and had been there before on business. With plans for adding vacation with wife, and wanting to stay in a different part of town, I wasn't sure what to expect but was willing to give the Montmarte area a try, and Les Tres Poussins Hotel was where we decided to stay based on Trip Advisor recommendations. We couldn't have been happier with our choice. The rooms aren't large but they were more than adequate and the kitchenette was an added treat. Actually, rooms in the Hilton aren't that much larger! The hotel must have been recently modernized, and the in-room bathroom was immaculate. Air conditioner worked great and bed was comfortable (we opted for two twins as the deluxe queen rooms were taken and only doubles were left). There are flat screen TV's in the rooms but just like the Hilton, you basically get CNN and BBC chanels and not a lot more in English. Musty odor in room each time upon entry, but quickly dissapated when window was opened, AC put on, and then window closed. The decor was charming and we opted for a room with a courtyard view which definitely was quiet, but not terribly scenic. The real charm of the courtyard can be found on the main floor, and it is a wonderful place to enjoy a quiet moment in what is otherwise a lively, charming Paris district that caters to the locals and reflects their lifestyle. The differences between this location and the Eiffel Tower area can be felt everywhere, from the little shops to the slow pace of the scenic cafes. Also, you are only a stones throw from the beautiful Sacre Coeur and on the other side is the "colorful" ambience of Pigalle, complete with Moulin Rouge. Les Tres Poussins is beautifully decorated. The hotel does have an elevator, albeit a bit small one, and the staff were all amazingly friendly and helpful. Seriously, the four or five staff at the reception desk that spanned our six day stay were incredible. We even bought one a small gift. What a week to remember. Check out Cafe Select and the bakery right across the street from that cafe. Also, ask about the Turkish restaurant not too far away (Sivan I think it is). Les Tres Poussins was the perfect hotel at the perfect location. I'm going back.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Paris, and we had read about hotel rooms without showers, rude staff, etc. but this hotel by any standards was excellent. Nice sized room, good sized bathroom with shower, we even had a small kitchen so could bring baguettes, fruit, and cheese to our room from the local markets.
