Staff was very pleasant and accommodating. Everything was very clean, quiet street, close to St. Georges Metro. Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Best Customer Service in Paris”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: From the time we checked in to the time we left, the staff at the hotel were surprisingly helpful. They called and made dinner reservations for us at a restaurant we selected. When we missed breakfast in the hotel the next day, the staff called the cafe around the corner to ask if it was okay for us to get breakfast there. Perhaps the best service we received in Paris. I would have given this hotel 5/5 stars except for one annoyance: the hot water in the shower ebbs and flows as the rest of the hotel uses it. Nothing too annoying - I would have given it a 4.5/5 if I could. It's everything people describe it as. Clean, well-located (near St. Georges metro in opera district), and helpful. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “So-so stay”
Reviews.Author: Troy_Maine_USA_Ari
Reviews.Content: There was nothing about Trois Poussins that my husband and I disliked, but then again, there was nothing we really liked, either. The staff is friendly, the room was fairly clean, and the breakfast was an average continental breakfast. If you can find a good deal on one of the budget hotel webpages (expedia or [---------], for instance), Trois Poussins would be a safe, but unextraordinary, bet for your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Cute, clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Silvercherry22
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for business for a week and had a very pleasant stay. We had to drive to work every day so it was very convenient to have a car park opposite the hotel, even though they charge a fortune and it gets full after 8pm. The rooms were very clean, newly decorated and some have a little kitchen. The bathroom was small but spotless. It is in a great location close to the Moulin rouge and Sacre Coeur but the windows give ou on a quiet street. You can also easily walk to the Opera from there. In the area there are several restaurants however that serve new French cuisine, ie traditional recipes revisited and served in big portions. The only let down was the breakfast, a bit on the light side when you have to do a trade show for 10 hours! Also would not recommend for disabled or elderly people, as many hotels in Paris, the breakfast room is in the basement so you hae to walk down a twirly staircase for brekkie. The staff were nice overall and very discreet, my boyfriend came to stay for a few nights and they had arranged a small separate bill for me to pay his breakfasts so it wouldnt be included on my companys receipt.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Metro stop”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Located only two blocks from the St Georges Metro stop, it was easy to get anywhere in Paris. The room was VERY tiny. I would've thought it was a European thing, but the rest of the places we stayed were not that small. It is however clean and updated. There is a very cute breakfast room and patio. But breakfast is not included in the price, so you will pay extra for it. Staff were satisfactory, but they were very hot-and-cold. One day the concierge would be very short almost rude, then the next day he'd be very friendly. Overall, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: gnozu
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from a 2-night stay in Les 3 Poussins. Very friendly and helpful staff, all seemingly with perfect English. The room was ok - nothing special, but great for the relatively modest price. The hotel has a nice, if small, courtyard where you can have breakfast in the summer. The hotel is just round the corner from a very cute little square in a fairly quiet, safe area of Paris. Very few tourists; plenty of chic locals. There are a couple of excellent cafes (friendly staff!), and a very popular Indian restaurant. Pigalle is about a 2 min walk away with good metro access and lots of cafes etc. I used to live in Paris, and I think Les 3 Poussins is a great place to stay if you're looking for a mid/budget-price hotel that's off the tourist-beaten-track, but that's also within easy access of lots of tourist attractions, cafes, shops, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is clean and quiet boutique style hotel in a very convenient location. It is well-priced and clean within easy access of the metro. The staff are friendly and helpful and are fluent in English. Well placed for local restaurants and coffee shops.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Aoraki Mount Cook National Park (Te Wahipounamu), New Zealand
Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little hotel - Everything I thought it was going to be.”
Reviews.Author: NettieNZ
Reviews.Content: I spent a fair bit of time looking at reviews of hotels before confirming my booking at Les Trois Poussins. It is exactly as it looks in the photos and the reviews certainly give a good impression - I was not disappointed when I arrived. The rooms are small, but this is to be expected of any Paris hotel. The rooms are nicely decorated with double glacing and air conditioning, so quiet and comfortable. I found the staff to be very helpful and no issues with speaking English. It is not in a tourist area, which I consider to be a good thing, but at the same time it is close to the Saint Georges Metro station which makes travel anywhere very easy. There are some lovely little shops in the area and it doesn't take long to walk to Montmartre and Sacre Coeur. Anyway I was quite impressed with the hotel and wouldn't hestitate to recommend it or to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a Family”
Reviews.Author: Xmaspresent
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took our 16 year old niece to Paris for the first time for three days last week -19th to 21st April. We booked online through Eurostar website having consulted Tripadvisor and found previous reviews very accurate. We had room 601 at the very top with the clear view of Sacre Coeur. Very clean room and loads of space. Bathroom is bijou but clean and who wants to stay in the bathroom for long ? We ate breakfast out following advice from other reviews. Turn right and at t-junction at end you will see great shops both up and down the street. We also picked our lunch there and found if you turned left the patisserie with red awning a block up on the corner always had a queue out the door and justifiably as the variagated pizza and apricot croissants were the best. Can't comment on local restaurants as we ate at Hard Rock Cafe (sorry not very Parisien but 16 year old niece loved it as did we as live music Wednesday night) and an Italian also in Boulevard Haussmann. The 67 bus doesn't run after 9pm as we found out after reading the info on the bus stop after 20 mins but the metro is always the savior and is just around the corner from the 3 chickens. The staff were very courteous and offered to book anything and get a taxi if we wanted. We are pretty independant but it was nice to get the offer. All in all we would recommend the hotel and would stay there again. Don't fret about Pigalle - if you head for Saint George metro, the stop for two local buses or the local streets for food you won't see anything untoward or be bothered as the immediate vicinity is quite gentile

Reviews.Title: “Good, unpretentious hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonSeb
Reviews.Content: * Small hotel, located in quiet street * Good location for sightseeing: close to subway station (Saint-George), or a short walk (10-minutes) to the main department store street (Boulevard Haussmann) * Friendly staff * Rooms are small, but clean and modern * Nice batroom (shower) * Nice breakfast area, in the basement Overall, this is a good, unpretentious hotel well located and fairly cheap. Feels a bit parisian, and is therefore part of the experience!

Reviews.Title: “A great find.”
Reviews.Author: Jaycee9
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from an excellent 5 nights' stay at the 3 Poussins in Paris....thanks to the previous Trip Advisor reviewers who pointed us in the right direction. The hotel is small and friendly in a quiet road in a non-tourist part of the city with lots of wonderful foodshops and restaurants nearby. The rooms are quite small but I understand this is common in Paris. They were very clean as was the en suite bathroom which only had a shower. We enjoyed the breakfast which had cereals,cheese,fruit salad,yogurt, rolls and croissants. We appreciated the free use of the safe in our room and the complimentary newspaper in the morning. We tried various restaurants in the area and found the Rose Bleue to have an adequate three course meal for 16 euros. We enjoyed the excellent food at the Cote 9ieme restaurant and also had a good meal at the Catalan restaurant (Ch'Ti?) a couple of streets up from the hotel. We thought the hotel was good value for money and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Had a terrific stay at Les Trois Poussins for 6 nights last week. The location was great. Lots of places within walking distance. The hotel was pretty quiet even though we were close to busy streets. The staff are very helpful and they speak English. The room did lack an alarm clock which was a little inconvenient but did have wake up call service. Our room had a kitchenette with 2 electric burners and a refigerator but no utensils or any kitchen supplies so that it kind off useless to us. THere were 2 plastic cups in the bathroom though. The breakfast is decent for a continental breakfast but the pastries are better at a local bakery. They had cereal,and yogurt at the hotel breakfast which is the reason I had the breakfast. The TV was a nice flat screen TV and hadabout 8 channels- many in French,one with an American movie. Overall, a nice clean hotel in a good location. Would definetly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “At Home in Paris”
Reviews.Author: CTSF
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a four night stay at this hotel and loved it. The location was good. It is a little out of the way but very easily accessable by metro and walking. It did not feel touristy at all. As you exit the hotel and turn to the right, the street, Rue de Martyr is filled with many great bakeries, restaurants, fromageries, etc. We tried at least four of the bakeries and they were all good! The hotel did recommend the Cafe Select for dinner (they even gave us a flyer that allowed us to receive complimentary aperitifs). The restaurant was an easy place to go for dinner, right around the corner, the menu was in french and english, the waitress was very nice, and the food was good. It was mostly tourists eating there but didn't feel too toursity. Not sure if a real French food lover would like it but it would probably be a nice, easy place to go your first night in town. We were able to walk to Montmarte easily and had it not been raining, we would probably have walked to other areas too. The metro is a quick walk but study a map as it took us a couple tries to find the quickest route. (By the way, we took the Air France Bus from CDG Airport to the Arc De Triumph stop, then took the metro to Pigalle and transferred to St. George. It sounds more complicated than it was but would not recommend if you have a lot of luggage). If you haven't been to Paris before, the metro is very convenient and easy to maneuver. The trains come every few minutes and even if you have to transfer the trips are usually pretty quick. Checking into the hotel was very easy and staff was friendly. We had reservations for a standard double room. Our room was on the first floor and we had a small kitchenette in our room which was very convenient (this must have been an upgrade). The room was nicely decorated but not luxurious. The bed was low to the ground but otherwise comfy. The bedroom and bathroom were not large but spacious enough and clean. The towels were very thin. The hotel was quiet and our room overlooked the street behind the hotel. At night, you couldn't hear anything which was nice for us jetlagged travelers. Overall, I would recommend this hotel. If you look at a map, you might think you are far from the center of the city but it is only about a 10 min metro ride to Musee D'Orsay or Arc de Triumph and other sites. Being out of the center of the city allows you to feel like you are in a less touristy area and in a real Parisian neighborhood. Also, we got a great price on expedia for the hotel (hard to say exactly becasue we got a package deal but paid probably about $120 US). Would definitely stay again and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “What a Pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I chose the Les Trois Poussin with a Eurostar booking. Having looked at some of the reviews this seemed to answer all our requirements. I was anxious to have a comfortable, well placed hotel as I was taking a friend visiting from Australia. It could not have been bettered. Walking distance to some of the most interesting sites and close to the Metro for others. The staff were very helpful and directed us to restaurants within our price range and suplied us with maps and much other information. The room was warm, comfortable and clean. Although at the front of the hotel we did not find noise a nuisance. We have already recommended this hotel to others and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Generally Les Trois Poisson is a medium quality hotel. Staff are a little hit and miss on their friendliness, but generally pleasant. Room was ok, but shower was a little mouldly and some tiles were damaged / missing. Position is excellent, close to rail and to the centre of Paris. Note of caution - hotel ticket prices to events don't include hotel commission, and the staff don't advise you of the aditional amounts until after the purchase has been agreed.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel”
Reviews.Author: jjwidds
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the 3 Chicks for 2 hights in Jan. This is a fantastic small hotel, it is close to Gare Du Nord, you could walk but we got a taxi for 6euro. There are dozens of cafes,bars,restaurants within easy walking distance, the metro is a 2 min walk around the corner. After dropping off our bags we walked into the centre-about 30mins stroll. It was a lovely sunny day so we walked to the Louvre then along the river bank to the Eiffel tower, then looped round to the Arc de Triumph and back up to the hotel...everything is within walking distance from the hotel. OK we were lucky with the weather. The hotel staff were all friendly helpful, spoke good English and we were able to leave our bags till 5pm on check out day. We were given a free upgrade to a room with a kitchen, not that we used it, this is Paris after all. Room was clean and comfortable, there was some noise of doors closing in other rooms but nothing excessive. We would definately stay there again..the deal we got cost £66 per night, not bad for Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Time at The Three Chicks”
Reviews.Author: kicio77
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Trois Poussin From Nov 15 to Nov 21, 2005. The hotel itself is very cute and friendly. By American standards, the room was small, but we found it very comfortable. The furniture and bath were in good condition, and the cleaning service was very good. The room had a small flat screen tv and built-in writing able. We stayed in room 501, facing the street. The street is a residential one. Attached are pictures of the view. The room was sound-proof and comfortable. The front desk was helpful and gracious. They helped me get my luggage to the hotel when my luggage came on a later flight than mine. My only complaint was that after four nights, the bed developped a small valley in the center. We booked through Expedia (via TripAdvisor) and received a stay 3 nights, receive 1 night free deal. This averaged to ~$120/night... all in all a very good deal. A few notes on food: *There is a wonderful, small creperie up the street no more than one block up the hill past the hotel... I think that the name is Ble Noir (picture a shaft of wheat). It's great for a late breakfast or a lighter lunch. The ham and cheese (jambon et frommage) crepe was really good. *Also on Rue de Martyrs (#91 maybe?), ~10 minutes walk from the hotel, there is a tasty Hungarian Restaurant. For ~20 euros, you can get a three course meal with a cocktail to start and a shot of vodka to finish. A really nice way to warm up after a cold day on the town. *When you're farther downtown sight-seeing, Leon's of Belgium is a nice stop. They are a chain, and there is even one off of the Pigalle stop. You can get a fantastic bucket of mussels, a never-ending supply of french fries, and glass of cool Belgian beer... so good! *Also Flam's is a fun Belgian version of Pizza Hut. The pizzas are ultra thin, and don't have tomato sauce. The toppings can be creative, and are really tasty. *Finally the Latin Quarter, a few steps from Notre Dame, has tiny streets, and is packed with restaurants. At night the area is very lively and is filled with students from the nearby universities and tourists alike. There lots of tasty fondue restaurants. Try the tartiflette (spelling?)to warm you up... it's a casserole of thinnly sliced potatoes, large chunks of bacon, and melted cheese. A comment on Pigalle... the earlier comments are correct. Trois Poussins is in between 2 metro lines, St Georges and Pigalle. You can completely avoid Pigalle by taking the metro at St Georges. Pigalle itself is not that bad. There are sex stores around, but not graphic images. It's in a completely safe, well-maintained neighborhood and I never felt unsafe or not at ease. At night you can see ladies in the bars waiting for clients. Other than that it's all ok. I'd recommend the Trois Poussin for a short stay in Paris. The hotel was very nice, and it was great to be in a quiet, non-touristy, residential street... after a few days, it almost felt like we had lived in Paris for a long time. Happy visiting and thanks to all of the previous reviewers for their comments and suggestions!

Reviews.Title: “Great little boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my wife for 3 nights in July. Booked deal through Eurostar at a great price. Double room on first floor with comfortable bed and modern flat screen TV. Plenty of cupboard space, small bath but shower was fine. Noisy if windows left open (normal for Paris) but very effective A/C system meant that windows could be closed at night with no ventilation problems. Staff very pleasant and helpful. Breakast perhaps a bit expensive at €10 each but there was plenty of choice. The hotel is only approx 10/15 mins walk from Gare Nord for the Eurostar and the Saint Georges Metro is just round the corner so no problems about getting to the centre of Paris quickly. A very good set of cafes and restaurants are nearby, in particular the well named "No Stress" Cafe! We would definitely stay again. Only issue: each night all the surrounding streets were closed as the "Da Vinci Code" was being filmed! Clearly not a problem for future visitors unless they make the "Da Vinci Code II"

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: MissyElliott
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after having found a great deal with Expedia and great reviews on trip advisor and it was everything I hoped it would be. Although it's not centrally located, we did walk to Galleries Lafayettes and the Champs Elysees and it really wasn't far. The room was great - our was on the ground floor and although we were initially worried about noise, we slept very well both nights. The staff were particularly good and helped us with all our queries (and there were a few!). Breakfast is expensive compared to local cafes but we found it to be very good and it was lovely to eat it the small courtyard. We used the red Paris Tour buses (nearest stop Galleries Lafayettes) to get around and found them to be very useful for getting our bearings and taking us from one sight to the next...there is also a running comentary available throught headphones which is great for a bit of background.

Reviews.Title: “A delight in the summer”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just back from Paris with my boyfriend. Paris was hot in this time of the year. It's great that this hotel offers 24hr air-conditioning, which is really wonderful after a hot day out. The neighborhood of St. Georges is decent and convenient with a daily market 2 blocks away from the hotel. There're a few nice cafes and restaurants acroos the street, good for a drink or grabbing a bite. However, if you're travelling by the Metro, prepare to transit for at least two to three times in order to get to all the actions downtown. Size of the room is quite small as compared to that of regular hotels in the US or South Asia. But, in European standard, the size is normal. Bathroom is clean and decent. We paid for Euro 118 per night for a double room and enjoyed a buy three get four promotion, i.e. around Euro 88.5 per night. Quite good value.

HotelInfo.Name: Les Trois Poussins Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 15 rue Clauzel, 75009 Paris, France
